I don't even know how my company found this place and why they would ever contract rooms here.
Shootouts in the lobby...the strangest people wandering around...and some of them work here...I did not feel safe even remaining on site.
This city is a hole and this hotel is just plain bizarre.
The gym equipment is as old as the wallpaper in the rooms, and half of it didn't work. The pool looked enticing, but alas, it's december.
My view was split. Half mountains and a wonderful sunset...resting atop train tracks, warehouses, and bums.
Keepin it weird...and trashy, Reno(Sparks).

Live music, great food and genuinely friendly service. I got to try crawfish and grilled cajun oysters. I love any place that has local favorites.
The location is awesome - right on the riverfront, and the band plays right outside. Even though the swamp heat did not allow me to sit outdoors to enjoy the music, I was quite fine with listening from my air conditioned seat right inside the patio windows.
Typical New Orleans specialty drinks. The Saints were on TV.
It is a fun place!

I do not remember this place right now - I will have to return to this review after checking out my pictures. hahaha!

I have a feeling this was the place with the surly bartender who would not take a picture with me...damn tourists.

Bourbon!

ah yes, a corner bar, location location location...
The entire staff seemed disgruntled. The bartender was not feeling the sherri-love, and didn't feel like talking with myself and the 1 or 2 other people at the bar.
The outdoor patio with live music is set up for a no lose situation. It's one of those places you can hang on the street and listen to great big band music - LIVE on the corner.
It's got the whole city feel, but I did not want to spend more money there because it just didn't have the personality of every other bar in the city.

So, check it out, from outside, I thought, typical tourist chain - when I got inside, that was exactly what it was.
But, great points: not-so-typical-fare like gator cakes, and gator bites. Great seafood gumbo, and the service was on point.
Live reggae music on Sunday night and a gift shop for t shirts and hats and such.
Honestly, the bartender rocked and the food was good. The mussels were good enough for me to eat all of them and not regret one morsel.
It's a fun place if you happen to be in Tampa and have nothing else to do.

So, they have updated the joint. The lines are reasonable(but I do have a crew badge). The food courts are limited. The issue I have with Lambert is the surly ass employees. 
Ghetto and surly.

This is one of my favorite overnights. Plenty to do, right on site.
Lots of restaurants, entertainment, and bars. If you are into gambling, there is that too. 
The pool area and gym and great for a hotel. I love the beach/ sand concept at the pool area.
The gym is spacious and well maintained.
There is a spa where I have gotten my hair done, and accommodates last minute appointments for hair, nails and massages (when there are openings). I find this entire establishment extremely accommodating and the staff is very friendly.
The bathroom is also spacious - which I appreciate when traveling. Any extra space is a bonus for me.

The breakfast sandwich I got was good. Crispy bacon. Egg cooked perfectly. The coffee was bitter. My tots were burnt.
So, for $7(with my discount) w t f!!

...but, it was fast.

Mmmm, here we go.
I love good food, and a restaurant that not only knows the quality of good food, but the clientele that they are serving, the culture of their city, and the value of outstanding service is #1 in my book.
We were given a heads up on this place, from a  Denver local who happened to be sitting next to us at Camilla, another favorite eatery in Nola. So, it was at the top of the must try list. Turns out it was right around the corner from the hotel and had a great ambiance.

I started out with a glass of wine, but was enticed into the signature drink by everyone in the joint that had one in hand. It wasn't my favorite, but I love a place that has a specialty. Classic.
I also heard over and over again about this fantastic bread pudding. I don't eat sweets but when in Rome...
Well done Bon Ton.
Every dish was prepared to my liking. I will admit, I was kind of bored with the whole creole - gumbo- N.O. typical menu, but Bon Ton does it and does it well.
Shit was good.

Great service! The wait and the air of a chain was an initial let down after hearing about how great the food was going to be, but no doubt, everything lived up to the expectations.
The food was f'ing great!
Great, I say!
Everyone told me about the crawfish bread which is well worth the trip to the south. I had blackened catfish, actually, everyone at the table had catfish in one form or another.
And Gawd damn! It was fantastic! 
Every dish had the southern flavor that we came down to experience.
You can order sides ala carte and everything is well worth a taste.
So Good!

Amaaaaaazing!
I don't even know where to start. The seafood (tower) appetizer with everything from crab legs, to oysters, to lobster claws was so frickin good I could barely control myself.
The service was impeccable.
Hostess, waitstaff, bar - ALL GOOD!
The steaks...Shut the Front Door!!! 
like Buttah!
in my mouth
on my tongue
I could do a dance...
but I won't
But I should
It it where I would like to be buried please
Mmmmmm heaven in Philly
Indeed

Oysters oysters oysters!
The interior resembles a Bubba Gumps or other chain, but we sat at the bar and simply enjoyed the food despite the average ambiance.
We tried 3 different types of oysters here. Fried oysters, oysters on the half shell and baked oysters that were so frickin delicious, we could have eaten 3 more dozen.
I would absolutely go back again and again to get my oyster fix.
The bartender was a treat as well. Informative and a great mixologist - she made our experience even better.

Melange was another fine dining experience. The food just got better and better everywhere I went.
I started with the shrimp remoulade, moved on to the duck and andouille gumbo, and then had a seafood dish I can't remember the name of but every bite of every dish was spectacular. Absolutely fantastic!
The cocktails were fun and the wine list was above par. Well matched with all the food items, every taste was a treat.
Traditional N'awlins fare with a gourmet twist. Lucky me.

It's a diner...
with drinks...
I spent about 5 minutes here and ran into the Quarter.

I like it.
Generates an air of politics.
Decent prices.
Cool bartender.
I had one of the best grilled cheese (w/ bacon and tomato) sandwiches I have ever had. Fries are good too. Great downtown location. Walking distance to the State House, and to Colts Stadium.

Ooooh Lawd! When I saw the line outside I knew there was something good inside. I had been joking with one of my crewmates about how, you know a city has good food when you run out of seatbelt extensions on the plane. There are also other indicators of amazing food, especially in a hidden little joint like this place.
Deanie's is kinda far from town.
It looks like an updated shack in the middle of the back woods on Louisiana (but well kept).
It has a front porch.
On this front porch were numerous couples waiting to get a seat inside and be served.
My sweet friend asked me if I wanted to stay, since there would obviously be a wait. I usually have good luck with situations like this, and I would definitely wait for the goodness I was sure was inside. We went in and the wait was an hour. But, they had a bar, and I had nothing better to do than catch up with my friend.  
When we stepped up to the bar I suggested just hovering as names were being called and eventually these people in the bar would get a table...and they did...and we bellied up to eat. We waited all of 3-5 minutes for a seat at the bar and we had drinks and dinner right there, with the most attentive bartender(s) and one of the owners.
I ordered the combo plate with oysters and catfish. My friend ordered some sort of crab souffle. 
DA BOMB!!!
Talk about ridiculous.
The potatoes were brought out first with our drinks - boiled in spicy crab seasoning, they were the best little red potatoes I've ever had.
The combo plate was tasty and the catfish was actually breaded more lightly than I anticipated and made for a delicious "typical" southern plate. The oysters were just damn good.
I tasted the crab souffle thingy and O M G! Melt in yo mouth goodness!
I don't know that I've had better southern cookin' and I know that I never should again, unless I give up on my body and decide to just go with the big panty look for the remainder of my life, because nothing good can come of eating meals like this more than once, than a big, fat ass.
And I mean that in the most respectful way.

ps they have a full service bar and Jack Honey drinks...What Da' hell!! Heaven in New Orleans I tell you!

pps the servings are huge

We were referred to them by our friends who used them for their wedding. We had Sara as our instructor for our First Dance for our wedding. She is A-M-A-Z-I-N-G. Super sweet and funny and was very flexible with our crazy work schedules. My husband wasn't the greatest with coordination, but she somehow broke him, and just danced flawlessly at our wedding. We didn't do a groupon or anything. We just bought the private dance package for 5 lessons. It includes Friday night parties, as well, but we didn't have time for it. I heard it was really fun and they held theme-parties.
Friendliest staff, clean, fast service, and accommodates all my demanding healthy substitutions without hesitation. Super nice!

They are not baby-friendly. Sat in the waiting area for 20 minutes waiting for a table to accommodate 2 adults and an 8 month old baby. Watched them seat 3 sets of customers varying from couples to large groups. They didn't apologize for the wait or reassured us there will be seating soon. The restaurant was not even full or busy. We ended up leaving. We have always visited this place and tolerated their lack of customer service, but today was the last straw for us. This place needs an intervention in order to keep their customers or appeal to all ages. Such a shame and disappointing to see such a local establishment turn bad.

We love this place. Yelped for healthy food...even better, healthy Chinese food popped up! Their dinners are so affordable and incredibly yummy, as well as super healthy. They have a large section of vegetarian and vegan options also! We ordered their dinner specials that are $7.75, comes with soup, egg rolls or crab puffs, rice and a main dish. Their portions were large enough for a healthy option and brown rice wasn't charged! Usually other places charge to upgrade to brown rice? But this place doesn't because they cook everything healthily. I love that their website also incorporates tips for healthy Chinese cooking. They also deliver! But, we live in the foothills and 12 miles away isn't in their radius :( But, we'll definitely be coming back more often. Also, Ming was super sweet and made the effort to get to know us and check on our dinner. A lot of restaurant owners don't do that anymore and we appreciate Ming/s personable traits that makes her regular customers want to come back all the time. Highly recommend this place. It's a hidden gem in the eastside! We're so glad to have found it!

Their gelato is really good and they carry an abundant amount of flavors. They do offer non-dairy items in the sherbet section. Two things that would improve their business: they need a punch card system to encourage customers to come back and their prices are a little high, compared to...no other gelato shops in Tucson -_- Makes sense. For two smalls, can equal up to $9. My fave is always Pistachio and Coconut.

Friendly, excellent, reasonable prices, very clean! I usually use my own tools but I didn't with them because I trusted how well they clean their equipment. It's a family owned and operated business, which means better customer service. Walked in without an appointment and waited less than 2 minutes to be seen. Parking is free and open. Jimmy worked on me and he is very detailed and thorough from cleaning to polish. Highly recommend. So happy they're only up the block from me!

This is our favorite place in Tucson. I love that it's a scratch kitchen and that the menu changes all the time! The cooks and owner are so friendly and personable. The food is always tasteful and fresh. They are so baby-friendly and always provide a little side of food for our 9 month old, which I think is so sweet of them. We feel comfortable eating here as a family rather than some other places who aren't so baby-friendly. We are vegetarians and like that they are conscious of gluten-free and vegan platters. They also offer cheese and eggs if you'd like. We highly recommend this place, but want to keep it as a hidden local gem for ourselves because it's getting very popular!

The best and only place to get an organic mani/pedi for pregnant women! If you're worried about harmful chemicals and fumes that may harm baby, GreenToes is the only salon that can rest assure be the safest and cleanest place to get your nails done. Plus, the techs are very nice and polite. It's pricey, but you pay for quality. In addition, I can't review on whether they do any designs or not - I haven't tried that yet, but I'm assuming you can't get Pinterest-worthy designs here.

Pros: It doesn't smell like formaldehyde like other salons. And they offer other services such as massages.
Cons: They don't have "spa" massage chairs.

Walked in for lunch in their new location and establishment. The place was a mess, the chairs were everywhere, the place was dirty, and there was no one inside the dining area and there were three people ahead of us waiting. After 5 minutes of no one paying attention to all of us, we all left. This was a bad move - they're trying to make this place a higher establishment. It's not functionally going well and the place looks like a dump. So sad for this restaurant. We miss the older location where it was thriving. They should take down the "now open" sign and work on their management because right now, it looks horrible.

We tried only their pho, spring rolls, and drinks. Food was delicious. I'm not used to the added meat on their spring rolls though and was $5 for two, usually its $5 for 4 at other spots, Taste-wise, yummy. We ordered a small pho, but it was gigantic. Their prices are affordable, everything under $10, their most expensive pho was $8-9 and their cheapest pho was $6.99 depending on size. Their drinks are really good, they have non-dairy options, and multiple toppings to choose from. I think adding 50cents to each topping is kinda steep though, when other places charge 25cents or tapioca is considered included for free. Their service was impeccable, from walking in, waiting for a table, to waiting our table. Hands-down the nicest and fastest Vietnamese crew. I couldn't give them a 5 star because one item that's missing are Vietnamese sandwiches. Tucson needs sandwiches...maybe open a Lee's next door ;) Other than that, great city restaurant for a small town!

Came here to look at wedding invitations. Great collection and fits anyone's budget from $150-$2,000 (for 100). If you're wondering, cheaper invitations are Carlson Craft and the priciest would be Vera Wang.  But, Carlson Craft has some with ecru paper and letterpress. They also offered us a 20% off coupon if we ordered from them. Ask the staff for their promotions going up until February. The staff is really nice, but the store gets quite busy and they don't have a designated person to solely help you with invitations. The place could use a little cleaning up too. Boxes were everywhere on the table where you flip through the books, but they apologized since they were stocking that week.

Too DIY for us though. They don't have anything in-house so it's another headache to find a calligrapher or someone to do return addressing. Saves you a couple hundred bucks to do it through this store, but its just not for us. We found a perfect company and person that has the same collection as Papyrus and does all the printing and wording etiquette for you. A couple hundred bucks more, but all the worth while for stress-free wedding planning :)

This place is very convenient and perfect for DIY couples. You don't need an appointment! Just walk through towards the back and help yourselves. When you're ready, just let the staff know and I"m sure they'll help you order, just not as quickly if the store is busy, so go on a weekday early morning.

Jose was our technician. He was very friendly, knowledgeable, clean, and fast! He brought his own booties to wear in the house without us asking. It's part of their service. He had every answer for all the questions we asked. He was prompt in the time window they booked us with. I highly recommend them.

My go-to nail salon in Tucson. I've been to 4 total, but this particular salon, is gold. I don't mind the extra dollars, being it more expensive than other establishments, but they're clean, honest, friendly, parking is a breeze, and they're easy to make appointments with. I usually bring my own tools, but I've watched how they clean it and they've assured me several times its cleaned, so now I go without them. I'm pretty picky with how people cut and clean my nails, so if you're like me, you can rest easy coming here. Their top coats are OPI, so I already knew they spent a little more for better products for their clients. Your choosing of a massage lotion are a nice touch. Julia is my fave. Vincent is also cool.

Geez Louise can we eat in peace?! 

Stars for our fave dish is the sizzling rice soup...but they need to make up their minds whether they want beef chicken or all...some days we get one or the other or all 3. C'mon now, we don't like surprises.

We can't stand dining in!!! Always feeling rushed to finish our food. Tonight was probably the worst...getting interrupted every 5 min to try to take our half eaten plates and bowls away. In fact, I was still eating my soup and she literally put her hand under the bowl ready to take it. I had to tell her TWICE "I'm still eating." WTF!!! I think we ate the fastest in record time 12 minutes because she wouldn't stop coming to our table and asking us if we want this or that to-go!! Ugh we might as well have packed it up the minute we received it. 

Customer service: Super rude, they don't smile, sometimes can't understand them!

Tip: Just do take out to avoid them ruining your appetite or just drive 5 more miles down for better Chinese food. 

Damnit Foothills and the lack of good food up here!

Take a ticket, wait for your number to be called shortly, and the friendly staff will help you out. If you're ordering dailies or daily contact wear, make sure to have your prescription with you or faxed in before you come. Also, it takes about 3-5 days for your order to come and NO, you cannot call and order it over the phone because you have to pre-pay it. Simple instructions and staff are prompt. They'll call you when its ready for pick up. Their prices are very competitive with other optometry offices. My boxes are $63.50 each for a 3 month supply for Accuvue dailies and you're never hassled by them to purchase a year supply, like other optometry businesses. Only thing is, parking is a nightmare and they don't have covered parking except tiny trees - not ideal for hot AZ weather.

Wow, my hundredth review.  I'm glad it's a burrito joint!  Grubbins!

Ok, when I first decided that we would come here, I was expecting the place to be dingy and kinda hippie.  I don't know why, maybe the name?  Anyway, this place is so not dingy.  It's like an independent Chipotle.  In fact, the Chipotle people probably got their idea from here, because the concept is very similar.

You wait in line, decide if you want nachos, a regular burrito, or a monster burrito.  You can get a quesadilla too.  Of course, I got the monster burrito.  So big!  Steak, rice, refried beans (should have gotten whole beans), cheese, salsa, crema.  And you buy a bag of chips to go with it.  

We crammed around a table to eat because it was all crowded.   It was all quiet from us as we got to business.  All really good and fresh.  I even saved half of the monster for later and ate it cold.  Umm hmm...  damn, I wish I had one now!

Late afternoon, this place rocks.  Great bartenders, trivia/poker playing machine thing, chill.  I like.

At night, there's the karaoke scene.  I personally wasn't into it.  The scene was very local and not especially friendly, in my opinion (obviously).

 At one point,  it seemed like one girl was singing and her 20 friends were dancing along with her on the dance floor.  Like bar aerobics or something.   Weird?

So, for afternoon drinking, all good.  Then go to Pepe's across the street, have dinner, go home!  No night scene here for me!

My friend and I decided to try Irene's on a Thursday afternoon.  So, after cooling our heels in a nearby bar waiting for the place to open, we walked over.  As I opened the door, I was greeted by a kind hostess who said she would take care of us.  It was pretty early, about 6:30, and we got seated right away at a table by the window, not in the darker back area.  The room was really charming and homey.

The waiter was really nice and explained everything.  My friend ended up ordering the filet mignon special.  I wanted something light and opted for the trout amandine, which was excellent.  The whipped sweet potatoes were great too.  There was a slight slip up in the service - they brought my friend the wrong dish - but it was quickly taken care of.  Also, she really enjoyed her Ramos Gin Fizz (her first).

A good time was had by all.

My cousin brought us to this place. We'd been to some other area bar the night before, and it wasn't a chill, good time like we wanted.  
So, I was happy that Break Time brought us the relaxed experience we were looking for.  Comfy chairs, lotsa space, kind bartender = success.  

It would probably actually be a 3.5 and I am rounding up because I am not familiar with this area at all and I got a nice vibe.  And my cousin was happy!
Oh, Ragin' Daisy had the perfect leopard print coat that actually FIT!  I wish I would have bought it, but I knew it wouldn't fit in my suitcase for the trip back home.  Regret!!!

Friendly local hang out, quiet.  I came here because it was close to my hotel.  They have a big TV if you are into that.  I enjoyed the eclectic music playing when I was there, vintage Madonna then Joy Division.  

Bartenders are really nice and the food was a pleasant surprise.  I had a great burger and fries one time, the mac and cheese special with a salad another time, and the tomato basil soup the last time.  All were really well cooked and flavorful.  It kind of became my go-to for a tasty, casual meal.

An old school steakhouse in an office building!  Let's go tiki!

I was bummed that they could seat us right away, because I really wanted to have a Mai Tai in the vinyl-padded-seat type bar.  God, I love a comfy padded barstool.  

We are guided to our table through a large, low lit room.  Copper lanterns are on every table and the menu is printed on an old Lancers bottle!  So cool, except that there's only one menu and we were a party of five, so it was a bit awkward.  

I ordered a steak and it came with a basic baked potato and salad bar.  The salad bar was simple but really good.  And I got bacon bits for my potato.  Everything was really good, the Mai Tais too.  And not all crazy expensive.

We had such a nice time this evening chatting, drinking and eating.  I really love places like this and I would definitely come back!!

I had my first po'boy here.  It started as a typical tourist experience:  we heard from a local that we met at a bar where to go, then proceeded to find it.  Took the Magazine St. bus there, walked through the charming neighborhood, then thought, "okay, what was that address..."

So, we realized that it really was that little house-looking place on the corner with no visible sign (coming from where we were).  Walked in and sort of watched what other people did.  Realized that you take a number from the wall, then they call you to take your order.  Okay, all good now.  Found a table, ordered some red cream soda from the bar and hung out.  I watched the ladies dip and fry each order as it came in - oh so fresh!

Then..."#35" Oh goody!  Fried oysters on a soft, toasted roll.  Umm, umm, umm!  Put on a bit of hot sauce, and there was little talk as we chowed down.

The best part was when I realized that the little steps going up the side of the place actually led to the owner's house (dur, I said it looked like a house).  Too cool!  I love that family thing!  God bless New Orleans!

On my first day in New Orleans, which I am completely in love with by the way, we spent a good amount of time sitting on the patio here.  We had been wandering around, kind of bored by the "usual" Bourbon St. haunts, and kept walking on and were rewarded.  Met some really nice people from New Orleans, had maybe too many cocktails, and watched the sun go down.  Can't wait to go back!

love the cafe. every time my gf and i go, she always manages to order way more than she should.  the menu is always fresh and there are plenty of options. service is quick and above all quality is #1.

The pho was bland and mine was actually overly sour.  I actually got a stomach ache after eating the pho. The menu was also a little more expensive than it should have been and had some offerings that weren't as authentic.  Honestly suggest Noodle City a bit further down Hollister.
I'm a serious fan of Garrett's. It's classic diner at it's best.  The service is prompt, polite and to the point and the food is delicious.

They seriously had me at "cone of meat"... 
We love stopping by here for the cones. The cones (meat and cheese) make great snacks while we wait for the sandwiches. 
Like the others have said, it's truly nice to have a go-to place for cheese in the area too.

Let me just start by saying that I recently moved to the area from LA and my review may be a bit biased because of the caliber of Thai food that I am normally used to.  I should also note that I frequent some of the better Thai establishments around LA county so my review is probably bias.

Meun Fan Thai simply fell on "ok" status for me. My girlfriend and I went here to have lunch one weekend and we were really disappointed by the limited menu offerings and the quality of the food after we had ordered. Sure this place is nice and clean, but just because you have a gold elephant on the wall, it doesn't make your restaurant legit Thai.
One of the first things that I noticed about the menu was the lack of noodle soups. Sure there are hot pot and tom yum but where's the boat noodle? That should be a simple thing to have on the menu and is usually a staple item on just about any Thai menu.
My girlfriend ordered the Pad Thai and while the color and flavor were present, the noodles were a shame. They were more pho noodle than typical rice stick noodle that pad thai usually is made with. This made it more soggy and not as good to eat.
My order of curry noodle had a brick of noodles sitting in curry sauce.  It was sad. How does one overcook a brick of pre-prepped noodles?

Anyway, needless to say, 10$ per dish was not pleasing. Sure we pay higher prices due to location and area but dishes of this quality and caliber would not have been any more than 7.50 on any other menu.

I've passed this place many many times and normally wrote it off because it was often not busy inside and it is at the tail end of the Albertson's parking lot where nothing is open. 
One day, while my gf and I were shopping, we stopped and looked at the menu and it was actually quite promising.  The prices were above average for what we would normally pay but we gave it a shot anyway.  
We ordered asada super nachos and an al pastor burrito. The food came quickly and i barely had time to raid the salsa bar b4 our togo order was ready. 
When we got home, we found that the burrito was massive and would have fed us and our dog alone.  The nachos were just as large and we were both equally impressed with the overall quality of the food that we had gotten. 
For a $10 plate of nachos and 8.95 for a burrito, the price was a tad high but it was worth it.  Since we're local, we'll definitely be back for another sampling of the menu.

This is probably one of the more authentic eateries that we've come across in the area.  They've got a large selection of items available but its done tapas style.  Ordering can quickly lead to an order of 6 items for 2 people and a bill of $30. But hey, its actually pretty worth it.  The tortillas are handmade, the cheese is authentic and isn't the typical orange and white cheese blend you're used to.  It amazed me that a kitchen so small was able to pump out food in such qty and volume. 
One of the things that made this place an experience was the menu.  If you're not good at deciding, try to get a glance at the menu or a picture of it while you're in line.  Usually, you don't see it until you're on deck for ordering @ the register and trying to make up your mind with 2 or 3 items that seem familiar can throw you.

The service was super polite even though we showed up just before closing. These guys are magicians and make magic with every order. It's so good that even though I had a PLT for dinner, I wanted to return the next day for lunch!
The fries and sandwiches are crack. You're gonna find me lifting busses and bugging you on the street just so i can get my next fix.

Honestly, I hesitate giving this place 5 stars only because I don't want Lito's to get over popular and be flooded by tourists and foodies who come to take pictures of their food and not eat it.
But in all seriousness, Lito's Deserves every one of the 5 stars given.  They have the best carnitas I've ever had... The carnitas are moist, tender, and simply wonderful in any form.  
Also, today, we found one of the best chicken Taquitos EVER.  Normally, from other places, the chicken tortilla would be overly dry and the chicken would pull out on the first bite. These were by far the opposite.  The chicken was moist and the generous amounts of amazing guacamole made each bite a joy. 
Another of my favorite things was Daniel.  He's the owner and the kind gent in that greets you and brings food to you. He's got a great charm and this place wouldn't be the same without him being there.
On today's trip, one of the neighborhood kids came in just to say "hi" to Daniel and the people working.  That kind of local love is the true testament to amazing food, and character of Lito's.

Being from Los Angeles, I say this with taquito grease and salsa in my veins...
Alberto's (and the copy cats like Alerto's, Alejandro's, Alfredo's, etc.), you've been replaced.

HP Autosport is simply the best place to go for service, and tuning. Wether you're in need of an oil change or a performance tune, Harold is the only person you'll need to contact. He was super accommodating and thorough and I've been in awe every time he's assisted me. His attention to detail and workmanship sets the bar for all other shops on the Central Coast.

Palazzio tonight was such a disappointment. My girlfriend and I wanted to get a simple dinner in before catching a movie tonight. We arrived just a little after 7 to a pretty packed house. There was a large party behind us and a bigger party ahead of us finishing up. We were never really seated. The host pointed us in a direction of three tables and let us choose our table. After sitting for a bit, no one came to us to greet us and I had to get up and walk to the host station to get menus myself. Again, no one helped. While going over the menu, a service aid came with garlic rolls and gave us each a few. We sat for another 15 minutes before the first server came to greet us. She apologized and thanked us for being patient and said she would be back. She never was.
To conclude, my girlfriend and I wasted 45 minutes here to not be served. We were never even offered water. We left some money for the garlic rolls that we ate while waiting, got up and left. Two servers watched is get up and leave and had no remorse.
I apologize for leaving such a long story with really no dining details but I really felt that I had to share such a poor experience. 
I can only hope that the person who took our tip, gave it to the man with the rolls because no one there did anything to deserve anything less than the one star left in this review
Probably one of my favorite things about Santa Barbara. Excellent drinks and amazing burgers.

My gf and I moved to the SB area a month ago and This is the closest thing to good Vietnamese food that Santa Barbara county has to offer.  The prices are fair and not inflated due to the area and there's a great variety on the menu.  
Service was actually very good tonight and that is why I nudged the 4th star.  The remainder of the reason is the food. It's fresh, authentic and isn't some washed out version of authentic vietnamese food.  It was nice to see a full menu that ranged from pho to mi xao (fried crispy noodle) to com tham bi cha ta (broken rice w/ shredded pork).
We will definitely be back.

My girlfriend and I gave this place a shot after driving home on state street.  We had seen the place many times before while visiting the area but decided to give it a shot because of the reviews.
The menu was simple and did have some happy hour/izakaya style small plate options. the rolls averaged 12$ and there wasn't a large variety. my gf and I each got a roll as well as a hand roll and takoyaki.
The food was fresh but the sushi rolls were loose and not memorable.
What was more memorable about the meal was the stench of the restaurant.  When i walked in, all I could smell is a stale wet odor singing my nostrils from the rear of the room.  It honestly smelled of old stale urine.
Another terrible thing to note was the service. There were two servers in the room to serve two tables and a full bar. They were slow and the service provided was terrible. you would think that once your meal is done and your table is clean, your check would come.. but no, they just let us sit there for another 30 minutes to absorb more of the stale urine smell.

I absolutely love Mac's.  The smell of this place fills the corner of State street and always makes me want to stop whenever I pass by.
This is hands down the best true fish n chip shop around.  Not just in SB county either, im talking LA, SD, pretty much any of California.

The fish is always moist and served in generous proportions.  The sausage is locally made and is magical in a sandwich but even better as part of the Toad in the Hole. 

I first came here with a group of friends not long after Mac's opened.  Now that he's been on DDD, it's like seeing a celebrity all the time. lol

The tacos here are amazing! I've been hoping for a place like for so long!
Tits hard to pick a stand-out but he ahi poke taco is amazing! If you're going to try some tacos, get the three taco combo and you get a free batting cage token too!

The fiancé and I had an amazing dinner here the other night. We came in on a quiet weekday and were pleasantly surprised at how wonderful everything was. 
Our service was top notch. Everyone was so attentive and polite. Heck even the live musicians cared how everything was going.
The meal was absolutely amazing. We started with wine and beer pairings to go with the roasted bone marrow. The portion was extremely generous and the dish came with a whole grain mustard and shallot salad that was simply amazing. My fiancé hates mustard and I avoid raw onions but we both cleaned the plate. Next we shared the duck confit and wild mushroom risotto. Again the portions were plentiful and the taste was simply amazing.
I can't think of any reason to  give the Black Sheep anything less than 5 stars.

There's a great selection of hard to find Korean groceries here and the food is amazing. It's seriously like being let into your Korean friend's house for dinner. There's homemade quality but amazing taste. Come here and try it!

Finally! A place in Santa Barbara to get a good bowl of Boat Noodles! 
I first visited Empty Bowl when the market first opened.  The line for Empty Bowl was an instant sign of something good... 
It's really nice to see good thai fare that doesn't resemble a chinese food menu.  
Also, the service here was great! they were fast and courteous.  We're definitely coming back for more.

Good experience with them. Called in a local delivery order around 1 pm and they had delivered it by 3:30 same day. I asked for a colorful arrangement at a price point and the person on the phone explained the size, types of flowers, etc. Was super painless experience and recipient loved the flowers. Bonus points for being able to deliver to the person without knowing the apartment number. Will definitely use them again.

I'm only snobby about 2 types of food living in LA, Korean and sushi. I take my sushi seriously in CA. For a sushi restaurant in willow grove, I'll admit I wasn't expecting a ton. But I was pleasantly surprised. This place is very solid, I would say comparable to any mid tier LA place but a lot more reasonable priced. Sushi deluxe for $21 including 9 nigiri, a California roll, salad and miso soup is solid. Also tried Gyoza and udon, both on point as well. Plus service is very attentive and pleasant. Nice decor as well. Will definitely come back when I am visiting the folks. Even better, no corkage fee!
Big fan, always come whenever I am in the area. High quality, good portions, very reasonable price. Friendly staff. Super lunch specials.
very solid! very friendly and great lunch specials! come here all the time when i am visiting my folks. americanized chinese, no complaints!

Great friendlys. Super nice and accommodating staff, able to deal with food allergies very easily. Food is spot on.  Big fan of munchies mania and milk shakes. Clean and ample parking. Not sure why people complained about the service but our waiter was great and manager even stopped by to make sure everything was good. Will definitely come back.

By far the best hotel in the area (have stayed at the Hilton, Hampton inn, best western). Will definitely stay here again. Brand new renovation. On par with an aloft or spring hill suites. Free breakfast buffet is awesome. Like seriously awesome. Even my brother who only stays at places like the four seasons said it was great. Very reasonably priced as well with plenty of parking.

Just. Awesome. Italian hoagie w/ the works is bomb. High quality meats and use a crustier roll than the traditional Amoroso roll. Little bit more expensive than most places but worth every penny. I dream about the Italian hoagies when I am not in the area...
Two words: corn grits. Enough said! Soooooooo good.

It's so cute whenever I hear someone pronounce praline (pra-leen). I bought half a pound, thinking I was going to hand it out to friends and family in Houston but I ended up eating the whole thing in one day. It's that good, if you have a sweet tooth! When I'm pms-ing, it's all I dream about. Definitely coming back and buying in bulk...

I love fried stuff. I love sugar. I love coffee. Yum!! Although nothing out of this world, if you're passing through NOLA, stop by here to have just one beignet, just to say you've been! It's very touristy and crowded but I didn't mind the wait. Beignets are the same everywhere and I can make them at home myself but it's fun to grab a couple to go with their coffee and walk around the French Quarter. Put some powdered sugar on your nose too, so you look like a crack addict. It's fun! If you're a fan of Vietnamese coffee, Cafe du Monde coffee is what we use to make it (we add condensed milk, du Monde doesn't). As a little girl, I remember my mom buying the yellow cans of Cafe du Monde coffee at the Asian grocery stores in TX (she still does) so it's kinda fun to see where it actually comes from :)

I was excited to pop in here because it's right next to Harrah's and I thought "Ooh, shopping like Vegas!!" But, it's a teeny tiny shopping center with your regular mall stores. Parking is validated so I just bought a bottle of tea at Starbucks. Apparently, Saks is the only upscale store in NOLA and it's located right here in the Shops. Really?? I saw lots of fashionable people while I was here, NOLA deserves more than just one Saks. Anyways, the one thing I really hated was that the parking garage stinks of pee and it took 15 minutes to get on any elevator, not kidding. There's no stairs either!! Sheesh.

The usual rule of thumb is that if the location and exterior is crap, the food is usually good. But not so in this case. I'm Vietnamese and while the food was decent, it is definitely catered to the Western palate, although not as bad as other places I've been to. I was quite disappointed that my bun nem nuong had very dry, crunchy vermicelli noodles. I've reheated plenty of day old noodles at home so I can recognize it when I see it. The broth in the pho was ok but it was not as rich as it should be. I wouldn't go back to this place. However, it is a good stepping stone for those who are scared to try Vietnamese food.

I came here hoping for an unexpected treasure but left disappointed. There were lots of designer bargains in the store but unfortunately still out of my price range or size. Vera Wang, Marc Jacobs, Prada. Not much selection for men. However, I did see lots of 7 for all mankind, a couple True Religions and Citizens for $40!!!! But none in my size. Ugh!!! It's one of those places where you gotta dig or have lots of luck. Oh well...next time...
Sunday tasting menu is terrific. Leave it to the chef to feed you good stuff
Terrific burgers, if a little overpriced. Try the various pickles too, especially beets and tomatoes.
Whoa! Roast pork with broccoli raab and sharp provolone. It's da bomb

Very tasty vegetarian options. Good prices. Friendly staff. I had the vegetable timbale and it was amazing. Husband had grilled vegetable wrap and he said it was delish but not as filling as he would like. The toppings bar is great with lots of sauces and extras. Highly recommended for a quick lunch bite.
Best sushi place by far! This place far surpasses any sushi place back in California. Great service, fish is always fresh, and the rolls are amazing. My favorites are the 11am and the Donald Duck.

Oh my love.  Best fro yo I've ever had.  HUGE selection of flavors - I went with the cupcake batter, swirled with a bit of chocolate.  They also had Reeses, cookies and cream, blueberry tart, peach, sour apple...you name it, they had it.  There were also lots of tasty, fresh toppings.  My only complaint - they are stingy with the samples!  Only one per customer?  Maybe they are mitigating the problem of having people come in and only sample, not buy.  Who knows.  Also there are signs posted everywhere warning you not to eat any yogurt before you pay...ok, that's the norm.  Again, maybe this is an issue at this particular fro yo joint.

Anyway, I was in heaven while eating my chocolate-cupcake batter fro yo topped with brownie crumbles, a few cookie dough crumbles, sprinkles, and chocolate syrup.  Also, I'm one of those people who usually ends up weighing my yogurt and discovering that I've just made an $8 creation.  Not this time - I was out the door for just over $5, including a tip.  What a steal!  Love this place.

I would never usually get a mall cheesesteak, but I made the mistake of believing that one from Tony Luke's HAD to be good. I was wrong.
There are not enough descriptive words in the English language to say how BAD my chicken cheesesteak was. Just getting in from Springfield Mall and felt compelled to write this review because my food was so terrible.

Number one.... I don't even know why Tony Luke would put his name on this location. It is NOT EVEN CLOSE to his original location.  My sandwich wasn't even as good as one made from Steak-Umm. The chicken was hard, old and tasted like it had freezer burn.  The mayonnaise tasted like it had been left sitting out. There were not enough onions. The best thing about the sandwich was the bread, so that's what I ate.

Waaaay too slow!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  OMG.... and a moron answered the phone just now when I ordered take out.  My fiance' and I were regulars at the one in Ardmore, and I actually prefer the one in Ardmore to this location. This one is really crowded and pretty noisy.  The one in Ardmore is perfect for a quiet Saturday morning breakfast or a lazy afternoon lunch.  I used to bring my laptop there and get work done all the time.

The City Ave. location is much too noisy to do my work.  Of course, this crowd is probably only temporary. Can't wait till this place gets old so the regulars can eat in peace. We went on Thursday afternoon, and it was filled with everyone from all the City Avenue office buildings.  Must have waited in line 15 min.

What's good here? For breakfast, I like the french toast and eggs, and for lunch, definitely the Uptown Turkey.

Damn, that cheesesteak was good! (licks fingers greedily!) 

Just left Mama's and got a chicken cheesesteak.  Was totally surprised when the guy at the counter told me they didn't sell fries. Okay... no problem.  They sell chips.  No fountain sodas??  I hesitated. I really hate sodas out of a can/bottle with no ice.   Decided to roll with the punches since my friend Jeff hyped this place up so much and ordered a bottle of coke.

To my surprise, my order came to $16.  HUH??????????????????????Awfully steep, considering I didn't get any fries!!! Left there feeling kinda pissed.

When I took my sandwich out of the bag, the first thing I noticed was how heavy the sandwich felt.  Heavier than cheesesteaks I get at any other place.

Then I unwrapped it and bit into it. DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  It was absolutely the best chicken cheesesteak I have EVER had!!!  Seriously! I have no idea why this thing was so good, but I'm guessing it must be the cheese. It has just the right amount!!  You know how at some places, you might lift your roll and wonder if they forgot to put cheese on your sandwich?? Not here. You will definitely see and taste the cheese.

And what kind of cheese IS that?  Yummmmmy!!!!!!!!!!!!   It didn't taste like any kind of provolone cheese I've ever had.  I'm not b.s.-ing you when I tell you that it was the most perfect cheesesteak ever. Oh... and it was HUGE!!!  I ate half and felt like a fat pig!! lol  

I can't believe I've lived right down the street from this place and never tried it. I will absolutely be back there. Five WELL-DESERVED stars!!!!!

EFF this place. No, seriously.  I placed an online delivery order from their website at 6:00. At 6:45 I called to confirm my order.  The girl who answered the phone put me on hold to "search" for my order. After about 2 minutes, she told me they were "backed up" and would get it ready in a few minutes. I'm no stranger to the bs line when it comes to delivery places.  I know a few minutes usually equals an hour or more.  The only problem was I paid for this order already and I was starving!!!  Then the girl asked me if I could come in and pick the order up.  Ummm...no. I have conditioner in my hair and it is 43 degrees out...hence the DELIVERY ORDER.  

Finally, I said forget it and cancel the order. She tells me I need to cancel through Ordersnapp.  When I called them to cancel the order, they told me it would take at least 24 hours for my refund to post. So... basically, I wasted my f##### money tonight. I can't even begin to describe how angry this makes me.  Ended up having to place ANOTHER takeout order from a different place. NEVER EVER AGAIN.

I had a HORRIBLE experience at this store.  I literally stood in line and was almost completely IGNORED for 45 minutes.  I couldn't believe it. I watched 3 sales people scamper around to help an obvious drug dealer and his stripper girlfriend as they purchased 3 purses and 2 wallets and paid in 1's, 5's, and 10's. Next to them was an older couple that I guess looked like they "had money".  They were getting most of the attention when I was in the store. Ordinary, middle-class, working people can FORGET being waited on in here.

After waiting 40 minutes, I couldn't take it anymore. I walked up to a lady who had walked past me about 5 times without a word and gave her an earful. She apologized profusely (of course), and then stopped whatever she was doing to "help" me.   I told her, "No thank you," and asked if I could speak to a manager because I have a complaint about how I was treated.  She said all complaints are handled at the regional office.  I let her know that I would be calling that office after I leave. Next, I told her I wanted a Speedy 35.  She did a little "search" on her computer and told me they were completely out of Speedy monograms in that store. After reiterating to her how rude the salesclerks were, I left the store.

I called the regional office about a minute later, and they apologized as well.  The person I spoke to asked me if I knew what product I was interested in. I told her,"Yes... a Speedy 35, but they were out of them."  She told me,"Actually, no they are not. They have them in stock."  WHAAAAAT? So on top of being treated like crap, the chick in the LV store LIED to me?  Wow!

The girl on the complaint line offered to call the store ad have them hold the bag for me. I told her there was no way in HELL I would give that store my business, and gave her the name of the woman from the store. Once again, she apologized and assured me that this goes against LV's policies, and blah blah blah.

Bottom line... avoid this store like the plague.

P.S.- This comment goes out to Jessica V. , a Yelper on this thread who posted that people who complain about "crap service" need to "buck up" because it's a mall store. According to her, no one should be treated "special" because it's a luxury store. I disagree, sweetie.  If you read my post, you'll see I was NOT browsing. I went in there knowing exactly what I wanted. All I needed was a salesperson to get it for me. Sorry if that kind of treatment is acceptable to you, but I prefer to be treated with respect.

I was a permanent fixture at Crispy Sweetie when it first opened.  I had a serious addiction to their apple brownies!!! Since then, I have probably popped in about once every 4 months or so. 

It's a tiny little shop that basically sells JUNK. Donuts, brownies, soda, pretzels, candy hotdogs, as well as sweet potato cake, carrot cakes and a host of other snacks. 

Ryan's right... it's nothing glamorous, but it'sa good spot to stop in for plain old coffee,(not capuccino!)  tea (not CHAI!)   and  a variety of donuts.

I have to change my review because of poor customer service. I just left this place, and I attempted to use my credit card here.  There was a note on their machine that you have to "swipe" your card instead of inserting it in the chip reader. I did just that, and the machine showed me a message that said,"Card Error."  My card has the chip, so sometimes I have to swipe it a few times for machines such as this one (older machines, I guess) to run it through. Well, their cashier was kind enough to announce in front of a whole line of people,""Your card has been declined!"   No....IDIOT! There is a big difference between a card being declined and a card error. How dare you announce to the world that my card was declined? 

I just thought this was very rude and inconsiderate, especially since the problem was with their MACHINE and not with my CARD. If you're a manager of this location, you might want to have a chat with your cashiers.  I'm sure we have all been in this situation at  least ONCE, and I did not appreciate his attempt at embarrassing me.

Nope. My fiance and I stopped in on a Friday night maybe 2 months ago. We live in the area and like to support all the new businesses.  Well....when we walked in, the guy in their uploaded pics never greeted us or looked up from what he was doing. It was astonishing that he would ignore us...the place was still pretty new and completely empty.  We looked at the menu for a minute, and still...the guy never even made a move to speak to us or help us. We decided to eat somewhere else. Obviously, customers aren't a priority here.

The best thing about Jyoti is the price!! Compared to other Indian restaurants, Jyoti is considerably cheaper! I have been here twice and thought the food was good here.  I have had the Butter Chicken, Aloo Mirch, Saag Paneer, Chana Masala, samosas, and Naan.  The first time we ate here, my fiance' and I ordered platters.  The second time, we ordered our food  a la carte and had leftovers the next night.

I didn't think the lady who worked here was particularly friendly, but would still return because I enjoyed the food. She was very friendly to my fiance'- just very standoffish toward me.
This is my favorite place to get ice cream in Philly! They're open later than a lot of places and the ice cream is fantastic.

This is a soulfood/seafood/hibachi takeout restaurant. You read right! This place just opened up, and it sells fish, fried chicken, pork chops, turkey wings, beef and pork bbq ribs, shrimp, scallops and clams, as well as mac and cheese, black eyed peas, collard greens (with turkey not pork), candied yams, string beans, potato salad, cabbage, cole slaw and potato salad-- as well as sweet potato pie, banana pudding and peach cobbler.  

But let's not forget the hibachi! This places makes all your hibachi favorites (shrimp, steak, shrimp, scallops, chicken, salmon, whitefish, and tilapia), and that comes with steamed rice (they even have brown), and steamed vegetables.  

At first I was reluctant to eat at a place that tries to "do so much."  I mean, let's be honest, would YOU trust it?  The place is kind of close to home, and sells fish at a decent price (Six dollars for a fish platter and two sides), so I owed it to myself to try it.  I got the whiting platter, and it wasn't bad.  Now, don't come here expecting soul food like your Grandma from Alabama makes. This isn't it! However, the food is still pretty good and the price is right. I will definitely come again. As one customer in the restaurant put it,"It's very clean tasting."  I would agree with that. My food wasn't greasy or very spicy, and it was cooked fresh while I waited and good for the price.Make sure you load up on salt, pepper and hot sauce packets. You will need them! lol
This is where we get all our fruits and veggies.  Always fresh.... only problem-- they don't take credit cards, which is pretty inconvenient.

Bobby's is just ok to me. I'll stick to Red Robin for my chicken burgers. I ordered the Dallas Burger:  spicy chicken, coleslaw, pickles, monterey jack cheese, and bbq sauce on a roll.  Mediocre.  Maybe because I got it to go. Perhaps if I had eaten it at the restaurant I'd have enjoyed it more, who knows? 

Equally unimpressive were the fries and the "fry sauce."  I saw no need for the spicy fry sauce because my burger was already spicy. Overall, I'd say Bobby's would be ok in a pinch, but not my first choice for a burger.

I really enjoyed my lunch at Rybread today. I ordered the "Rybread" which was: (As defined by their website) crab cake, greens. tomato and  chipotle mayo served on a sandwich bun. (Kind of a buttery roll, like they have at Chick-Fil-A. LOL) 

If you love Crabcakes, you'll love this sandwich!! A little spicy, but delicious all the same! I ordered a mango iced tea, chips, and a carrot cupcake for dessert.

Rybread is not cheap, as can be expected of restaurants in the Art Museum area, but the place is cute, the staff is friendly and you'll love your food.

How is that I grew up literally minutes away from this place and just visited it for the first time a few weeks ago????  Anyway.. it was cool. Loved the variety of fresh fruit and vegetables. The BEST part for me though was going into the Amish Market and leaving with some apple dumplings! YUMMMMMMY!!!!!!!!!!

Maggiano's is officially my favorite italian chain.  I've been to this location twice,and both times my food was perfect. Our waitress' customer service skills left a lot to be desired, but my food was so good I could almost overlook that.

We were here on New Year's Eve and again for Valentine's Day. I ordered the Chicken Marsala  with spaghetti marinara and my fiance' ordered the Lemon Herb Salmon.   Again, both were very good. For dessert we had the Chocolate Zuccotto cake, which was humongous and took us three days to finish! lol.

The only thing I would change about Maggiano's is their bread- there's nothing to it. They should at least make a nice olive oil dip for you like other restaurants, but they just give it to you plain.
Having lunch at Panera right this minute. The lobster sandwich is good, but way overpriced.

I absolutely LOVE Zoe's. My fiance' and I have been there twice, and our food was very enjoyable.  I ordered the Salmon Kebabs and he had the Chicken. Both were very good. If you order kebabs, I would suggest order one of each.  Our salads were crisp, and the hummus was very good. I'm usually not a fan of hummus.  Our meals also came with rice and some vegetables like squash and zucchini and greek salad.  I topped it off with some chocolate cake and went home full and satisfied.  They also have great customer service here.

I like Joe's, but I prefer the location in Wilmington. It's right on the waterfont and has a cool atmosphere. That said, I was pleasantly surprised by the one in KOP. I thought it would be small and crowded, but it was pretty spacious inside.  Based on the fact that it's located at the mall, I doubt we'll ever do anything but takeout here.

We ordered Snapper Ponchatrain and the Blackened Tilapia. I liked my bf's snapper, but my tilapia was way too salty. I found that pretty much everything they make at Joe's is too salty except for their steampots. (They are always good unless someone brings you a cold pot or not enough crab legs in the pot.)

Overall, I love Joe's, and I'm so excited they are building around the corner from me. YAY!

We loved our lunch here.  We arrived shortly after 3 pm on a weekday, and they allowed us to have the lunch special anyway.  We both ordered General Tso's chicken, It was crispier than any other Chinese restaurant I've eaten at, and it was very, very good,  This place is proof that all Chinese restaurants are not the same.  Service here was wonderful as well.

P.J.'s was my favorite lunch spot when I used to work at a mortgage company in Mt. Laurel.  There is one thing here that keeps me coming back... the crab cakes. They are jumbo lump, and they're delicious! Also, the price isn't too bad. My crabcake platter was $9.99 with beach fries and cole slaw. My fiance had the same. It was hot as hell, but we ate out on the patio at a shady table. the waitress kept the drinks coming, but she slacked off in every other area.

First, she tried to tell my fiance that he told her he wanted a salad instead of fries. Bullsh-t. The only thing he said was he'll have what I'm having. Well, What I had was a crabcake sandwich, fries, coleslaw, and a salad.  How does that translate into,"I don't want fries?"  My fiance didn't feel like making waves with her, so he was just like,"Forget the fries."  My whole thing is, if I'm paying for them, I want them... period.  He is actually a very healthy eater, so he let it go.

Our waitress had some friends at the bar, so other than dropping off our drinks, we didn't see too much of her. I had to eat my fries with cocktail sauce instead of ketchup, and didn't have a clean fork to eat my salad and coleslaw.

I have only been to PJ's on off-days and times, so I can't speak about what its like on a busy Friday or Saturday night or during a game. This is the kind of place I like to go to when it's practically empty.  We love the crab cakes here, so of course, we will keep coming.

Tommy's... it pains me deeply to write this review, because you guys were so nice to me when I went there today. So sorry!!!  The truth is, I am NOT a fan!  I hated your chicken!

It was over-spiced like crazy, and you guys put that same nasty rub spice on everything else too: the fries AND the coleslaw. GROSS!!!! 

On top of that, I didn't like how I was forced to order more than I really wanted because of your lack of variety. The guy told me I had to either get a half chicken, whole chicken, wings, fingers or a breast.  That doesn't leave me a lot of choice!  All I wanted was maybe a leg.  Not an option here.  I'm not a huge fan of chicken, so I wasn't happy about this.

Meh!!! Maybe I should have gone with the fingers.

The hibachi shrimp tastes like food court food. Not horrible, but not fantastic. It will do when I'm in the mood for shrimp at a cheap price. It's nothing like the kind you would get from a real hibachi spot...more like shrimp with sauce dumped over it.

I still like this place, but I have a complaint.... a DOG should NEVER be allowed INSIDE the restaurant!!! I went here yesterday, and there was actually a DOG inside. Not a SEEING-EYE dog, just a DOG... and no one there BATTED AN EYE as the dog's fur flew all over the place.  Not a good look at all!!

I usually like the Golden Corral, but this one is the exception!!! It's so dirty!! There was food all over the floor-- in the dining area, and the serving area!!!  Granted--- the line was out the door, but still. Cleaning up HAS to be SOMEBODY'S job!!

I know it's just a $10 buffet, but that doesn't mean it can't be clean. Things like that are of the utmost importance to me. 

They are also pretty slow at bringing out new food to the buffet. It seemed like every time I got in line, there was nothing but empty containers of food.

This place is nothing compared to the ones I've been to in Maryland. They should take notes.

Went to Cake yesterday because my fiance' works in the area.  We only stopped in for tea. I also had a raspberry tart, which was pretty good. The decor of the place was kind of cool, so I think we'll return again for brunch. I'll update after we do.

Don't go here. They don't want your business.  This places gives terrible customer service and they don't give a damn.  If I thought there was a manager who cared, I would call and report their staff myself. As you can read from many of the posts before mine, no one here cares.  

My fiance' and I arrived at this location today (June 25, 2014) at about 3:00.  When we walked in there were two women carrying on a conversation together. I believe they were speaking a different language.  We stood there for about a minute reading the menu, and neither one of them looked in our direction. They just continued talking.  Finally, I looked at them (because it was obvious they had no intention of seeing us) and said hi. Neither one responded.  My fiance' and I exchanged glances and then he asked,"Are you closed or something?"  They acted like they didn't hear him, so I repeated,"Are you guys closed?"  One girl answered no, but acted like it was painful to speak to us.

At this point, my fiance' started heading for the door.  We had experienced this same level of weirdness at the restaurant's South Street location, so I knew he wanted no parts of this place.  I guess I thought things might have changed. Stupid me--I kept trying to give them a chance. I said,"So.... where should we sit? Can you show us to a table?"  The lady shrugged her shoulders and mumbled,"You can sit whereever you want- it's a free country."   I turned to look for my fiance', but he had walked out of the restaurant. Clearly- he had had enough.

I turned back to the women and said,"You guys just lost two customers. When customers come into a restaurant, they expect to be greeted and shown to a table.  Neither one of you spoke or even got out of your seat when we came in. You need to work on your customer service skills." They had the nerve to laugh at me.  

I REALLY hope the owner of this restaurant reads my review.  This is the second time I've been to one of their restaurants and although the food was good, service was awful.  We will not be returning, and judging from the other reviews, neither will a lot of other people.

We ate here yesterday. My fiance had the grilled chicken (I forgot the name) and I got the fried chicken sandwich.  His wasn't bad, but my chicken was fried EXTRA HARD, to the point where it actually hurt my teeth.  On top of that, the piece of chicken was HUGE, so it didn't really make for easy eating. It was an awkward, hard,  mediocre sandwich. It was my first time eating there, so I figured I would just try something new, instead of the typical food court fare.   Now that I've eaten here, I don't need to eat here again. It wasn't AWFUL, just nothing too impressive. The best bet here is probably the grilled chicken or grilled cheese, or just eat at Shake Shack, a few steps away.

Absolutely terrible.  I hesitated to write this review because our waitress was so kind.  This review is no reflection on her whatsoever.  This is strictly based on the horrific dining experience we had here about a month ago.

We arrived at the restaurant at 1:30, a half hour before brunch ends.  We offered to leave, but we were told it was ok to stay.  We should have gone with our first thought.  The food was absolutely awful.

I had bananas foster. It tasted rubbery and hard like it was old and microwaved repeatedly.  The bananas were too hard to bite. My fiance' had the chicken and waffles.  His waffles were gummy and his chicken was flavorless. Their potatoes were the worst either of us have ever tasted. We were extremely disappointed with our meals.

I should point out that the whole reason we stopped here in the first place was because we visited the Philadelphia location countless times in the past and the food was always fantastic. This was not even close to what we were accustomed to. Granted, we DID get there 30 minutes before brunch ended, so we probably got all the scraps, but I'd prefer they just say,"We're closing" and send us on our way.

Appearance-wise, the place is small, but charming. However, simply put.... the food was disgusting.  After we left, we ended up going to ANOTHER restaurant because we were still hungry. No one should ever have to do that.

Just stopped there for lunch earlier today and had a chicken empanada that was way too small and overpriced, but DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!!!!  Wow.... I wish I had ordered two. Used to go here all the time when it was Green Line.  I think I'll return to get another one of those empanadas. YUM!!!!!!!!

Are you people freakin' kidding me? Just left this diner after being ignored by about 4 waitresses. I should have known things would be bad after the hostess failed to greet us warmly. She slapped the menus down on the table without a word of acknowledgment. After sitting for 10 minutes with one waitress after another bypassing our table, we came to the conclusion that we must be invisible.  (Shrug). As we got up to leave, no one batted an eye. I made a comment to my fiance about how no one came to our table. Suddenly,  a waitress appeared out of  nowhere and asked innocently, "Oh...what table were you sitting at?"  Whatever. Guess we should be grateful.  Restaurants with poor customer service tend to have horrible food as well. You can keep it.

Went to this Rita's yesterday and tried Cheesecake water ice for the first time. DELICIOUS!!! Also sampled Swedish Fish flavor. Also delicious!!!!  I'll definitely be back to try these again, this time at the Rita's near me.

I hate this place. I hate any place where seating isn't available if you want it!!  LOL  Unfortunately, a lot of good artists play here, so I have ended up here a lot!

I used to go in the VIP section when I worked at Power 99, but now that I'm a regular Joe, I'm on the floor like everybody else! LOL .

I haven't had a taco this good since my trip to Playa del Carmen, Mexico!!!!!  Found this truck by accident. I was actually looking to grab a quick hotdog and lucked up to find Tacos Don Memo instead. I ordered a chicken taco and it was fantastic.Plus, the 2 guys working there were very nice, so I can see myself becoming a regular here.

I love to study here! I can't remember ever buying a book from this location, but they made a lot of money off of me at the cafe!! Sometimes it does get over-run with noisy college students who think their work is more important than mine, but for the most part  this is one of my favorite places to study.

This place is average. maybe I'm just mad because Dairyland,the place that was across the street from this, moved to Main Street. I know I'm not gnna be going there because parking is a pain. So.... I guess this has to be my icecream spot.

The worst thing about this place is that it makes you buy more icecream than you want. I'm lactose intolerant, so I can only handle a child sized sundae... but they only have gargantuan sizes.

Went again tonight and had the Hibachi Salmon. It was actually very good.  I also had cabbage and mac and cheese.  Now I know what to get when I eat here.  Salmon was fresh and my food was ready within 20 minutes.

I used to like this Macy's until recently.  I was in here last night buying jeans, and none of the dressing room doors have locks,  This would be fine, if they had a fitting room attendant to help their customers find fitting rooms.  They don't... so I had the pleasure of having other customers burst into my fitting room on three separate occasions, while Im in various stages of undress. Not cool at all.  On top of that, since no one monitors the fitting room, there are piles of clothes no one wanted, all over the place.... just a MESS!  The Macy's at Springfield Mall is the same way.

Worst of all, when I got home, I found out that the idiot cashier who waited on me left the ink sensor on my jeans, so now I have to go all the way back there to have it removed.

LOVE this place! The toppings are sooooo fresh and good, and there is such a nice variety of options.  You can go for the classics (Caspian, Pizza Salad, Dillon James), but I think it's so much better to create your own.  I put  red sauce, garlic grilled chicken, mushrooms, green peppers, onions, tomatoes and broccoli on mine and it was DELICIOUS!!!

To think we started to go to Cherry Hill Mall for pizza from the food court! This was a much better option.  I ate til I was about to explode and still had a lot left for lunch the next day.
The fish tacos are absolutely disgusting. NEVER AGAIN.  Nothing else needs to be said.

LOVED this Chinese spot when I lived in Lansdowne!!!  They only screwed up my order once.  I called in my order, and when I got there, no one remembered taking my call. WTF?? So I ended up having to leave w/o my food because I was on my way to work.  Other than that, this was one of TWO Chinese restaurants I ordered from regularly.

LOVE this place!!!!! As authentic as it gets, and definitely not for the faint of heart. The signs says PIZZA on the outside, but I've never seen anyone eating pizza here.  If they did, I'm sure the pizza would be great too, however, people come here for the tacos!  I love the chicken tacos. They come with 2 of the spiciest sauces I have ever tasted.  Even the salsa verde (which they consider mild) will bring tears to your eyes.  Anyway, I highly recommend this place.  The food is fantastic... and the guys who work here are pretty cool too.

Went for breakfast today. Prices are too high and the food is average.  Wanted to like it because it's a cute spot and in a convenient location, but probably won't go back. The service was fine here, but my bf said his bagel wasn't fresh, and my eggs and homefries were just blah. I have a feeling this place probably makes a pretty good deli sandwich, but alas, I may never know!!

LOWER THE PRICES, Mr. Katz,(Assuming there IS a Mr. Katz!)  and maybe I'll grace you with my presence again. LOL

Yum...yum... YUM!!!!! Is there anything better than an authentic Mexican restaurant? Their food is delicious!!! We found this place by accident. Even though I grew up in Mercer County,  we actually found it when we were in New Hope, PA (across the bridge) looking for a Mexican restaurant.  What a great find!  

We went yesterday (in the midst of a heatwave in the beginning of July). With that in mind, I ordered chicken tacos, because I didn't want a really heavy meal on a hot night. My fiance ordered the enchiladas verde.  Both were fantastic.  Everything on the menu sounded really good, so I know this will be a place we visit often.

Had lunch here last week.  Wasn't too impressed with the menu choices for lunch, but what a great place to sit, chat and enjoy the great summer weather. I am such a sucker for waterfront restaurants.  Anyway, I had the classic, stone-oven fired pizza (I know.... what a boring choice, right?)  He had the roasted red pepper hummus plate. Both were as good as can be expected when you order the blandest thing on a menu. 

Anyway, the best part for me was the atmosphere. I will have to return and try some other stuff on the menu and adjust my rating accordingly.

I used to be a real fan of their Cedar Planked Tilapia, so I was mad when they took that off of their menu!  Some upgrade!  I order takeout from this location fairly often, and now there's not a whole lot of healthy options on their menu.

I also order the Monterey Chicken w/o bacon, and no visit is complete without their White Chocolate Molten Lava cake. YUUUUUUUUUM!!!  Chili's is okay with me!!!

Heard about this place via NBC-10 and the Ellen Show, and didn't even realize it was the same Rosa's I was already going to for my slices! I love their pizza!! I'm always waiting in the car when my fiance goes in to buy our slices, and have never actually been inside this place.  I think what the owner is doing is a beautiful thing (free slices for the homeless).  That just makes me like this place even more.

Grilled Atlantic Salmon..... what a great lunch!!!I  It came with grilled zucchini, squash and broccoli and rice.  A nice change from the food court.

For our appetizer, we had he Crab Won Tons, which were just ok.  I didn't particularly care for the cream cheese they used. I've had better ones at Pei Wei. (Coincidentally, we're on our way to Pei Wei now!) LOL.

I will definitely return to Blue Pacific.

Just came back from Maggiano's about 20 mins. ago. it was my first time trying it out. My food was DELISH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I had the lemon herb salmon w/ crispy potatos and spinach.  DIVINE!I know you're supposed to get italian food at an italian spot, but I just wasn't in the mood for it.

My salmon was well-seasoned and my potatos were just the right amount of crispy!  After a slice of their mammoth-sized chocolate cake, (its name escapes me right now!), I left feeling satisfied.

I highly recommend Maggiano's!

Just left Fiesta... had the chicken gyro platter with Greek salad and fries. DEE-LIC-IOUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  The fries were pretty good too. Another plus? I got to WHIP my bf's ass in Ms. Pacman while we waited for our food! LOL 

I will DEFINITELY eat there again.

Finally made it to Green Eggs to check out their brunch.  We went by a few times before, but the line was always outside the restaurant and we never wanted to wait. Green Eggs is a solid restaurant.  I ordered shrimp and grits, and while I admit it wasn't the best I've ever had, it wasn't too bad.  The problem was that most of the restaurants that make this dish make it creole style and use a sausage gravy and chicken sausage mixed with tomatos and onions and some spices.That's what I'm used to! Green Eggs used nothing, so it was pretty bland in comparison.  I just had shrimp and grits last week at Silk City, and theirs was much better.

My fiance' had the creme brulee' french toast with berries, and I could tell by his face he wasn't overwhelmed. In fact, the only time we are really overwhelmed with brunch is when we eat at Sabrina's, but I like to give other places a try from time to time.

On a positive note, the servers were polite and attentive, and my food and my tea was nice and hot. I love when my server gets my order exactly right and i never have to ask for things like cream, sugar, butter, or ketchup.

I like the vibe of Green Eggs, so it's definitely a place we'll return to.

When a yogurt place is named "Top This", I'm expecting to be BLOWN AWAY!! Unfortunately, I wasn't.  My bf and I were there on Saint Patrick's Day and the place was packed with St. Patrick's day party-ers.I think this was more likely by default(it was late, and they were open)  than because the yogurt is good.

For starters, I agree with the person below me who said the yogurt is too sweet. It is... and not in a good way.  Their red velvet yogurt tastes NOTHING like yogurt and has a funny aftertaste.

They have a nice selection of toppings, but they are hard and old. The only thing that made me give a 2 instead of a 1 was how nice the cashier was. He was smiling and very friendly, and that's rare to see nowadays.

Yum, yum, yum, and oh yeah.....YUM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   I love the butterfly shrimp  here. They are HUGE!  I love this place because it's close to home, and I can get my seafood fix without having to drive too far to get it. I have only ever ordered the butterfly shrimp, but my fiance has had the mussels and snowcrabs and said they were delicious! Next time I come here, I'm gonna try the crabcakes.

The only thing I don't like is the parking.

OK... we went to Rx 2 weeks ago, and let me just say RX SUCKS!!!!!!!!!! First of all, our waiter had a very non-chalant attitude and wasn't very friendly to us. I asked if I could order my eggs in my crabcake benedict SCRAMBLED instead of poached. He said he would go ask the cook.  He came back about 10 seconds later and said the cook couldn't do it. EXCUSE ME???? I have always ordered my eggs this way at other restaurants and it is never a problem. I mean, think about it, all you're doing is throwing a couple eggs in the pan, whisking and stirring.  

Well, I was a bit taken aback.  Nevertheless, I found something else on the menu because my bf really wanted some cornflake frenchtoast. So.. I ordered the simplest thing on the menu, eggs and toast. I asked for them scrambled with onions and cheese, and again he said he needed to ask the cook if they could do it. He comes back again and told me the cook said no. They had no cheese or onions to make the eggs. We have been to RX before, and I ordered my eggs this way with no resistance from the waitress or cook. At this point, I knew one or BOTH of them were just being an a- -, so we told him forget it, and left.

The thing that pissed me off the most was how the waiter made no attempt whatsoever to accommodate us or get us to stay. He could have been more apologetic (no apology was offered), he could have suggested something else on the menu, but he did nothing. He honestly didn't care if we stayed or went. I guess RX doesn't need their customers.
This is the coolest Panera I've been to. It"s prettty big, they have payment kiosks and since it's new, everyone is really friendly. I just found my new homework spot.
