I've been to all of the Sabrina's locations because this is absolutely my favorite place to get breakfast in the area.  Out of all of the locations, the Wynnewood location is my least favorite.  We went last night and had the Roasted Chicken special, which was surprisingly bland and uneventful for Sabrina's.  It was tender and cooked well... just did not really excite my senses like their entrees usually do.  Anyway... the reason this location is my least favorite is because of the behavior of the children.  Yes, there are children at the other locations, but for some reason at THIS location, the kids seem to be out of their seats, moving freely and noisily around the restaurant and being bothersome to other patrons. I love kids, but when I'm eating, I would prefer they remain at their own tables with their parents instead of coming to mine.  Just my vent....but as far as the food, Sabrina's is fantastic. The Islander sandwich (tuna burger),  stuffed french toast, huevos rancheros, are just some of the reasons this is the top brunch spot in the area.

Tried to give this place a second chance a few weeks ago at lunch time. My fiance and I were basically ignored by both the hostess AND the waitress. The hostess took forever to seat us...she whizzed past us about 5 times and said nothing. Finally, I asked the bartender to seat us and give us menus, and she did. Another 10 minutes passed and our waitress still hadn't surfaced. Did I mention this was LUNCHTIME, so our time was limited? Most restaurants understand this. The last straw for me was when our waitress finally showed up, she went straight to a table with patrons seated after us. So...this place gets no more passes from me. Bad food + Bad Service = no reason to return.

I like Food Tek. This was one of my lunch spots I went to all the time when I worked for B-101. I usually stuck to their turkey wraps or turkey reubens, but I've heard they make a pretty good cheesesteak.

When are they going to upgrade this theater?  If you are a MoviePass or Sinemia member, be warned. This theater doesn't have recliner seats, picture quality and sound is terrible and so are the snacks. I was at this theater a few weeks ago for "Sorry to Bother You", and Boots Riley (writer of the movie) was there.

Customer service sucks as well.  I was trying to find out from one of the staff members what theater the movie was in, and while I was talking to him, some man rudely interrupted the conversation to ask a question. Rather than tell that customer to wait a second, the staff member stopped talking to ME and answered his question first. Rude and chauvinistic. They can keep this dirty, unprofessional theater.

Sabrina's is still my favorite brunch restaurant, butI have to give an update based on my lunch experience the other day. I ordered the Mel's Cutlet and my fiance' ordered the Islander.  We weren't fans of either. I should note that Sabrina's has changed the way they make the Islander.  We were huge fans of the old way: tuna steak with balsamic onions and wasabi mayonnaise.  It was our reliable stand-by for lunch. Well, the NEW Islander has wontons, sliced cucumbers, and tomatoes, with yuzu and chili mayonnaise. My fiance' said it was very bland compared to the original Islander.

The Mel's Chicken Cutlet seems to be a favorite on their menu. I had never tried it, so I decided I'd take a chance.  I hated it. The chicken was overcooked, and so hard that it was painful to bite it.  The sandwich comes with melted provolone, spinach and long hots....but no sauce. In my opinion, this made the sandwich incredibly boring. If there was a sauce, maybe it could have helped the chicken a bit.  I asked for mayonnaise, but even THAT didn't remedy the problem.  My waitress asked if I would like to order anything else, but I honestly hate to be THAT person when I'm in a restaurant. I thanked her and told her no. 

So...now we know we need to stick to the brunch or menu, and avoid the sandwiches.

Every time I've passed this shop, I thought the people in line must be CRAZY to wait that long for ICECREAM! Well, today, I finally sampled it (on a whim). There was no line, and I just happened to be walking past.  

I ordered a hot fudge sundae, which cost about $10.It was honestly THE BEST hot fudge sundae I've ever tasted. The whipped cream was so creamy and thick and so was the icecream. I could have ate a whole bowl of the hot fudge... it was THAT good!

I can't say I will be a frequent visitor to this spot. I HATE lines, and the place filled up quickly today while I was there. However.... this will definitely be a place I go to when I want to treat myself.

Ate here again on Friday, and as usual, my food was excellent!!!  I'm adding an extra star now because our waiter was kind enough to move our table outside so my bf and I could eat outside. Unfortunately, it started to rain, but I appreciated the effort!  

People who came here expecting glitz and glamour know very little about authentic Jamaican spots. Forget about the fact that it was in a movie.....if you want some fantasy dining experience, go eat at a Beaches resort or something or go eat at Bahama Breeze.

My food came within 15 minutes and the service was wonderful. Yah Mon....

I love this place, especially their crab wontons, lettuce wraps, Ginger Salmon and Mongolian Chicken, Beef, or Shrimp. I love the atmosphere too. Even though it's a chain, it's one of my favorite places to eat.

Found this place because I was starving during my late class in grad. school.  Not good..... not good at all. Mind you, I ordered SHRIMP FRIED RICE! How do you screw that up? Well, they found a way.  My rice was rock-hard and flavorless and there were about 5 shrimp in my pint.   I have never tasted BAD shrimp fried rice, most places know how to make AT LEAST that.... except Chinese Delight.

My bf and I just ordered takeout from Honey's. The person who took our order was extremely RUDE and SHORT with us. Granted, it was close to their closing time, but not THAT close where anyone should have had an attitude about it. If that's the case, tell us you're closed!!!!   

Honey's is getting beside themselves now because of their so-called popularity. They need to remember that it was the CUSTOMERS who made it so. (Especially YELPERS.)

We didn't appreciate the sarcastic and "smart-alecky" tone the cashier took with us.

I must be a glutton for punishment. I gave Larry's another chance and it actually became my "go to" place when I want a chicken cheesesteak...... until today.   Larry's gave me a serious case of food poisoning a few years back that left me sick and on a specialized diet for about a month.  Fast forward to today. I had a chicken cheesesteak for lunch, and I can feel the makings of another illness coming on.  Something is definitely not right abut this place.

This is one of my favorite breakfast places, and definitely my favorite place to get banana pancakes. Those things are massive, and they come with a delicious buttery syrup/ sauce that tastes so much better than regular syrup. This place also has the best fresh squeezed Valencia orange juice.  My fiance and I were going here every weekend for a while, but took a break after the hostesses started to recognize us.  I highly recommend Grand Luxe, with no hesitation.

Had lunch here the other day.  Not bad, but I've had better. The Makhani Chicken was a little on the tough side.  Loved the Chana Masala, Saag Paneer, and the salad was crisp and fresh. The naan was ok, but they didn't have mango OR tamarind chutney. This was a major disappointment for me. Nevertheless, the Ghulab Jamun, Kheer and Chai tea were all okay.

This review is strictly for the delivery service.I used to teach in this area, and I ordered from this place weekly.  Sometimes I would have my students go down and pick up my orders for me when I was unable to leave the classroom.  Well, one of those times, I had my students pick up the order, I was supposed to get $10 back in change. I sent a note down with my students saying that his tip was $4.00 The delivery guy took it upon himself to pocket ALL of my change.  Mind you, I tip... and I tip NICELY, but I d-mn sure was not tipping him $14.00.  This made me angry, to know that he really thought he deserved that much money for coming around the corner and dropping off a cold box of pizza.  

As for the food, it's ok.  The pizza is good, when it's HOT. TWICE I ordered from them for my class pizza parties and it was delivered to me ICE COLD. They also make good strombolis and chicken cheesesteaks.  Not a TERRIBLE choice, if you MUST order from here, just count your change if you get delivery.

We ate at Jones again today, and I have to say,"No, No, NO, Jones!!!!!!!!!!  You do NOT serve Chicken and Waffles with a bland CHICKEN GRAVY!!!" IT does NOTHING to bring out the flavor of the chicken OR waffles. Terrible gravy. Luckily, the chicken didn't need it, and we ate the waffles with syrup.

While we're on the subject of waffles, what was up with the HALF of Belgian waffle you guys served us?  I have never been given a HALF of waffle at a restaurant before. Surely you guys can splurge a little and give us a WHOLE waffle.

I was looking for a breakfast spot w/ good pancakes because IHOP  on City Avenue doesn't always take phone orders. Trio is going to be the place.Wow.... what a menu!  Chicken and waffles! Fish and grits!Salmon cakes! Crab cakes! Chipped Beef! Monte Cristo sandwiches! Omelettes! And for lunch, things like Salmon Terikyaki, cheesesteaks, tuna melts, bufffalo wings hoagies and quesadillas.

My pancakes were hot, fresh and GOOD and my scrambled eggs needed no seasoning whatsoever and were cooked perfectly!!

I only wish the place was open later than 3, because I could see myself going here a lot!!! Also, they are closed on Sundays, which is when I usually get my pancake cravings. :(

I'm going to try to be as gentle as I can with this review.  I went to Total Serenity yesterday for a massage, and it was a horrific experience.  I'm trying to be gentle, because the woman who took care of me seemed to be somewhat nice. However, she has absolutely NO EXPERIENCE with professional massage. I get better backrubs from my 7 year old niece.

I would have to agree with one of the other people who posted before me who said that the masseuse had no technique, just straight up and down rubs.  At first, I thought this was just her way of prepping or warming up my muscles. I kept thinking to myself,"Okay, NOW the real massage will begin!!" LOL. Well, after saying that about 20-30 times, I knew this woman didn't know the first thing about a REAL massage. This made me mad, because my back and neck were full of stress knots.

Well, the worst was yet to come.  She moved on to my legs and started doing some crazy technique that made me want to yell out in pain!!!  I get massages fairly often at other places, so I'm pretty sure she was doing it WRONG. Every person who ever massaged my calves and thighs did it in a relaxing way to get the kinks out.

On top of that, I think this woman had a BUTT FETISH!!!  LOL. I'm laughing right now, but I wasn't laughing yesterday.  As she massaged my thighs, she made sure to end each stroke with a handful of my butt.Each time, she stroked it slow and sensually, almost like she thought it was turning me on!  EWWW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I don't want that kind of massage from a woman!!!  It was sooo unbelievably uncomfortable.  

I felt bad, because my bf gave me the massage as one of my birthday gifts, and instead of leaving the salon relaxed and refreshed, I felt even more tense and stressed from clenching my butt cheeks every time her hand grazed and caressed it. When it was over, I couldn't get to the exit FAST ENOUGH!! lol. To add insult to injury, she had the nerve to hand me an empty envelope, indicating that she was expecting to get a tip.  Well, I ended up tipping her a few dollars, because in the end, I usually DO tip people when I receive any kind of service. Trust me, I would have rather kept that money in my wallet. 

I understand that for some people, the butt massage is no big deal, but I would have preferred to be asked. Don't just grab it and HAVE AT IT without my permission. This experience has me so jaded, that I doubt I will ever go to a spa for a massage again. I'll stick to Massage Envy and places in the mall. They do a better job anyway and for much less money.

Oh, and forget about trying to get an appointment here. It took me two weeks to get mine, because no one answered the phone during business hours, and then when you leave a message, no one calls you back!

Do yourself a favor, don't go to Total Serenity for a massage. I can't speak on their other services, but massages are definitely not their forte'.

My bf and I ate here last Sunday. I ordered eggs, homefries and toast. My food was DELICIOUS!!!!  I know my meal was a plain meal, but their cook added a little flair to it. My potatos were so flavorful, my eggs were cooked just right.  My food was outstanding!!!

We went to Honey's at 3:00 this time, so there was no crowd, and I was able to enjoy my food more than the first time.

Not bad.  Not the BEST crabcake i've ever had, but certainly, very tasty.if I had never tasted a Maryland crab cake, maybe this place wouldn't have such big shoes to fill. I have to agree with the others, there is more filler than I'm accustomed to in my crabcakes.  I got a sandwich, and it came with chips and a pickle.  Not bad for $7.99.  

I will DEFINITELY return because this place will do in a pinch when I can't get to Baltimore. Thank you to my friend in Delaware for turning me on to this place.

This will be my final update on Larry's. Found out that the chicken cheesesteak I ate gave me E.Coli food poisoning!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  My fiance' was also sick.  I'm not sure if it was just a bad day for them or not, but I thought I should let everyone know. Larry's is obviously doing SOMETHING wrong! I will spare you the details on what I had to do to find out what was wrong with me from my doctor.  I have never been this sick before from something I ate.

The best thing I've had here is the Black Bean Chicken. It is DELICIOUS, and comes with all kinds of vegetables!  I usually just stick to broccoli, carrots, onions, peppers, and mushrooms.  They offer a lot of atypical chinese entrees.

Just had a horrible lunch here. Ordered the Salmon Bento box. The servers brought everything in the wrong order, totally screwing up my meal. First they brought my salmon and mashed potatoes. Then they brought my asparagus. Then they brought my salad. Then they brought my soup. The salmon and potatoes were cold. The asparagus was on a dirty plate with hard egg yolk on it. The soup came about 10 minutes into the meal and tasted horrible.  The salad was the best part. 

I left the restaurant hungry and dissatisfied. Ended up having Chick Fil A for lunch.

They're having a rough time.  My fiance and I stopped in to try it out and they took forever to give us our order, and when they did it was wrong. We were kind of in a hurry and thought we could stop in and get a quick dinner. WRONG.  For starters, there were about 12 people working that night, and no one knew what to do.  There were 3 people cutting a pita wrap for the person in front of us. WHY?  Two of them could have been starting orders from the quickly forming line in back of us.  At the second station, there were about 3 people putting the fixins inside of the pita. Again,  too many people at one station, confusing each other.  There were 3 more people at the last station, bagging orders and then the manager rang up the order.

Soooo... with all of these PEOPLE, why is it that when I got home, my chicken shawarma pita wasn't even in the bag??? So, we had to go allll the way back.  My fiance thought that maybe they just forgot it to put it in the bag, and it would be at the counter, but noooo, they actually stuck it in someone else's bag! We had to wait AGAIN for the sandwich to be made all over again.  Did I mention we were in a hurry? 

Overall, the food was ok. The sauces were pretty spicy, but that was a good thing. Double check your order before you leave, though.

My bf and I used to always go to Christiana when we were in college.  Back then, it was a run-of-the-mill mall with outdated clothes/stores. We mostly went there for the food court.

 Well, fast forward to 2011!! This mall has TOTALLY changed!!!  Wow! This mall can now compete with Cherry Hill Mall!! Out of nowhere, this mall became more upscale, and has stores I would actually shop in!!!

What a refreshing change from crowded King of Prussia, which is the mall closest to me.  I imagine that Christiana Mall gets pretty crowded on weekends, though. (After all, what else is there to DO in Delaware but go to the mall?) LOL.

Just left Honey Grow and stopped at the condiment counter to get forks and sauces, and noticed one of their employees was on my heels.  At first I thought she was trying to get past me so I stepped aside.  When it became apparent she wasn't, I continued getting my sauces and forks. That's when it hit me. The drink machine is over here. She's trying to make sure I'm not taking a free drink.  Well... IDIOT, I didn't even have a CUP, so there was no need to stand so close to me that I could feel your breath on my back.

Managers of Honey Grow... you have GOT to come up with a better form of security than this. If you are that protective over your soda machine, put it behind the counter. This was intrusive, insulting and annoying. I just spent $40 in your restaurant, but will never spend another penny there. Keep your soda.

This place is really starting to grow on me. Ever since I discovered how good their pancakes are, my fiance' and I have been stopping in here every couple of weeks or so. Their pancakes are perfect every time, and I have never had them brought to me cold. (Yet!) I'm super-picky about my pancakes, so that means a lot to me.

I also love that they have real maple syrup. Definitely a plus for me!

I was hoping to make Larry's my alternative cheesesteak place when I can't get to Allegro's, but that's just NOT GONNA HAPPEN.  Just ate there a few minutes ago, and my stomach is killing me!!!   Not sure why, really. My chicken cheesesteak wasn't TERRIBLE.... just kind of bland.  I had to keep putting salt and pepper on it for it to taste like anything, and even THAT didn't really help.

They also chop their mushrooms and onions so small that you can barely taste them. Their fries were pretty good, but kind of greasy. I;m guessing THIS might be where the stomach ache came from. 

I'll probably give Larry's another try at some point, but I won't be getting another cheesesteak from them again. It just wasn't good at all.


*********************************************************************

A day later, my stomach is still killing me!!!!!  I'm convinced this place puts ex-lax in their food. I will NEVER EVER EVER go back to this place. I can't remember ever having stomach pains this bad. AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE.

I'm NOT, by any means, a jogger. However, I'm WORKING on it!  lol  I'm a champion speed-walker, and for now, that's good enough for me! lol  That being said, I have to tell you about one of my favorite walking spots!

There is nothing like a nice morning walk at Valley Green. My bf and I love to start our weekends off that way, the earlier the better. Not to sound corny, but it's so quiet and peaceful out there, just you and nature. There's something soothing about the sound of the cool, running stream and fresh morning air. It's therapeutic, almost.

We usually find a good brunch spot after our walk. What a great way to spend a Saturday morning.

I love this place! Went today for takeout and got the "Boy Am I Hungry." (Yep... that's what it's called! LOL)  It consisted of eggs any style, french toast or waffle,bacon or sausage, (and yes, they have turkey!), and homefries or grits. Once again, my food was delicious!!!

Add to that how friendly the staff is, and Centennial is among my favorite brunch spots in Philly! I'm so glad most of you Yelpers haven't caught onto this place yet. One more plus about this place, they had their HEAT ON!!!!! Can't tell you how much I hate to be cold when I'm eating!!  It truly ruins a meal for me. 

Centennial is cozy.... the kind of place where you'll linger around after eating and have a second or third cup of coffee. (Or in my case, TEA!!)

Yes, I'm late!! But I finally got my Mac!! Every August for the past 3 years, I said I would get it, because I know that's when they have their back-to-school promotion. Well 2 years go, I got sidetracked by HP, and ended up buying a laptop from them and regretted it ever since!!  Finally, I resisted the temptation to keep an extra $700 in my pocket by buying a PC, and I went with my HEART. Yes, my HEART, because I have always loved Macs, but what can I say? I love clothes too, so.... well..... you know!! LOL

Our salesgirl was Eva, and she was new, but she knew her stuff.Best of all, she didn't come off as a "Know-it-all" or make me feel like an imbecile for some of my questions. Heidi was also very nice and helpful.

I got a free printer and a $100 gift card, so I'm a happy camper right about now. Best of all, I bought my Mac TAX-FREE.  The store was packed, but we were acknowledged the minute we stepped in the store, and I had my computer in my hand within 10 minutes, hassle-free. It made parting with close to $2000 almost painless. (I said ALMOST.) lol. Of course, I'm still basking in the afterglow of my new computer. This could all change when I need support. lol.
Ok... I had to update again because it's now 4 days later, and I'm still sick!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  This is crazy... a serious case of food poisoning.
My favorite spot in the food court!!!! I usually get either the Bourbon Chicken or the Blackened Fish, plantains, noodles and or/ cabbage. Cheap and filling....

Had breakfast here for the first time in a long time. The pancakes are still very good and so are the potatos.  I do, however, see what people mean about the rude service.  While not directed at me personally, I detected a nonchalant attitude from one of the owners.  

A customer complained to her that there was not enough meat on her cheesesteak, and that she wanted her money back.  The owner told her she would only give her HALF of her money back, because she ate HALF of her sandwich. From my vantage point, I could clearly see the girl had only taken one bite out of it. Most places would just offer a total refund or make her something else to eat and apologize. i don't like the way that was handled at all.

What followed was an unnecessary argument that could have been avoided if the owner had just tried harder to accommodate the customer. It's little things like this that makes the difference between a dissatisfied customer and a returning one.

Thanks to all the Yelpers who recommended this place. Once again, you haven't let me down. The food is great here and so was the service!! I had the Chicken and Black Bean Sauce, bf had the Lamb with pesto, and a friend had the General Tso's Chicken. All of us enjoyed our food, so again... thanks.

Okay, Two DAYS later and I'm still feeling the effects of that cheesesteak. Why?? Did they cook my chicken cheesesteak on a dirty grill that had remnants of pork juice on it, maybe??  I am in bed BALLED UP right now.  

 Larry's..... I hate you!!!

This place has new owners and now serves "average" food.  I ate there today, and my $9.00 sandwich was AWFUL.  The bread was dry and old and so was the turkey. None of the ingredients in the sandwich were fresh. My coconut brownie was dried out and at least 2 weeks old, but they still over-charged me for it.

The place was empty!  After tasting that sandwich, I see why. It's NOTHING like it used to be. There were 2 people in the place, and they both either worked there or owned the place.  On top of that, the woman that worked there wasn't very friendly.  

I won't return to Centennial unless they get a total revamp. If they don't, I give them until December before the place is shut down.

It is time to upgrade this theater. How does this theater expect to compete with theaters that have recliner seats and restaurants?  It's in a prime location, so I expect they will upgrade it soon.  Price-wise, they are every bit as expensive as a theater with more "frills."  I would suggest driving further down rt. 38 and going to Regal Moorestown instead.  

Seats, picture quality, and sound are horrible.  Bathrooms are filthy.  Be careful when ordering their snacks. Last time I ate here, I was served a hotdog that wasn't completely cooked and was sick for days.

Sampled their freezing cold buffet in July, 2017.  The place was empty, and my fiance' and I were the only customers. The food was good, but I don't think I should have to ask the waitress to microwave my plate of food for me.  That's a problem.  As I said before, the food has potential, but if it's not hot, who wants it?  Also... I love a clean floor as much as anyone else, but NOT while I'm eating. Someone decided mopping the floor with bleach while customers were eating was a good idea. For me... it was the final straw. We will not return.

No, Becks.... Shrimp Po' Boys are definitely not your specialty. Not at all. Mine had entirely too much bread, my sauce was mediocre, and my shrimp kept falling awkwardly out of my roll.  I won't get this again here.

Now, the Shrimp Etouffee? THAT is definitely your thing! Yours is DELICIOUS!!!! I'm not sure why I didn't order that or the jambalaya in the first place. Actually, I do know. It was 95 degrees outside and I just didn't want anything that hot or heavy in my stomach. Luckily, my fiance' ordered it and was gracious enough to share his. Damn, it was GOOD, and I was immediately jealous because I knew he had the better entree.  Also enjoyed the cornbread- it complemented the etouffee nicely.  

Most importantly, the staff is exceptionally friendly. In fact, they were the reason we stopped there in the first place. They invited us to sample a few of their entrees and once we tasted them, it was a done deal.  I just wish I had ordered one of THOSE entrees instead of the Po' Boy.

I'm an A-list member, so I visit this location often.  For some reason, this location ALWAYS has problems on the first night of a movie premiere.  I have gone 4 times so far and sat for up to 2 hours to wait for them to get the movie together.  There's always an issue:  hard drive error, projection issue, movie wasn't uploaded, etc.  Sometimes they give credits, other times they just leave you sitting and wondering and offer nothing. When you go out and speak to a staff member, their "go to" line is,"The movie will be on in 5 minutes."  Last week, we went to a movie that was supposed to start at at about 9. The movie didn't start until 11:20. Ridiculous. At least offer free drinks to the people that stick around.

I have made 2 complaints about this location,  and that's because the staff is awful. It honestly doesn't matter who takes your order because no one here has customer service skills. They don't greet you at all.  They're unfriendly.  They never tell you how much your order is. They make you look at the screen below the window yourself rather than extend a simple ounce of courtesy.  As I said, I've complained before, and someone contacted me by email, apologizing and claiming they will talk to and retrain their staff. I stopped in 3 days ago to see their new and improved customer service skills, and was treated just as poorly as before  by an older Indian woman. I smiled and said hello. She ignored me all 3 times, then rudely stuck her hand out of the window to take my money. This has got to be the worst location ever. These people clearly hate their jobs. I recommend everyone drive to the one at 5200 City Avenue, or better yet...go to Starbucks.  At least they made an effort to rebuild their image by demonstrating to their customers that they value their patronage.
Went again for lunch and got a waitress who INSISTED on placing us right smack next to another couple even though the place was empty!! I'm liking this place less and less......

Went here for dessert the other night with my fiancé'. We originally planned to have dinner here, but nothing on the menu sparked our interest, so we decided to get dinner from Bahama Breeze and dessert from Grand Luxe.  I like the atmosphere, and it definitely reminds me of the Cheesecake Factory. I assume they are owned by the same people.

Anyway, my bf and I both had the bread pudding. It was really good.  Nice and moist... I hate a dried out bread pudding.  This place is pretty expensive, and they do have a variety of entrees on their menu, but nothing that made me say,"I've gotta have that!"  I wasn't blown away by it.

We may stop in here for lunch some time for sandwiches. Their outside patio looked so inviting, I'll go back for that alone!

I went to this location ONE time to buy supplies for my classroom when I was teaching, and will never go again.  While I was in line waiting to have my items rung up, a man walked up in front of me and put his things on the belt or whatever. I said,"Excuse me, sir... I was next."  He laughed and said,"You slow, you blow..." and continued to pull his things out of his shopping cart.  Rather than stop this man from cutting in line, the male cashier laughed and said,"Right? Oh well!" and finished his transaction.  He continued to laugh after the man was gone and told me to,"smile" because "it's not that serious."   I told him we'll see what his manager thinks and left the store.  

I reported this incident to the management, but who knows whether or not it was addressed.  Just thought I should add my two cents because as I can see, this store has continued to specialize in poor customer service.  Some things never change.
Shrimp and Grits  +  Pumpkin French Toast  =  SCORE!!!   Nap time! lol

I really HATE shopping at Whole Foods. Not for the same reasons as most people.  I don't mind paying extra for organic food. My fiance is a very healthy eater, and I am TRYING harder to be.  We do a lot of our grocery shopping here, so I'm used to the steep prices. My issue is with the people that shop here. They are RUDE. I'm not sure what it is about Whole Foods that brings out the a-hole in people, but people in this store seem to leave their manners at the door.

For one thing, everyone seems to be in a hurry. They all think whatever THEY came in to buy is more important than what YOU came in to buy.  So... there's constantly people reaching over you to get something (usually without saying "excuse Me"), and lots of "near-misses" with shopping carts.  When we are in Whole Foods, we like to read labels for ingredients and the customers here just don't allow for you to shop leisurely. No matter where you go in the store, you are made to feel like you are in someone's way.  

My rating is based solely on my experiences with the customers. Quality-wise, everyone knows Whole Foods always has fresh produce and we buy a lot of our seafood here. I also like the salad bar, selection of vitamins and herbal supplements and cosmetics.  In fact, if I could remove the customers from this store, I would probably give Whole Foods a solid 4 or 5.

Let's be honest. H & M's clothes are cheap in quality! ( I mean... the thinnest, flimsiest material!! LOL !! ) But.... every now and then, I can find something in there. I have friends who swear by this store, but for me it's pretty hit or miss! So... this weekend, I bought FOUR dresses! CUTE! Each one was $20 or under.  My kind of prices!

Now.... I would never be so bold as to purchase SHOES from there!That's going a bit too far!  I might buy a cheap DRESS, but I will never in my LIFE buy a pair of cheap shoes. (You won't catch me slippin' and slidin'!! LOL )

Gotta go! Time to throw on one of my dresses now! LOL...
Went for brunch last week and had the crabcake omelette which was DELICIOUS! This is one of my favorite places to get takeout.

Uh oh,Blue2o, I'm worried about you. This will make the SECOND bad meal I've had there. Tsk, tsk tsk!!!  We went there on Saturday for dinner, and I ordered the pretzel-crusted tilapia. It was absolutely terrible. The crust was hard and tasteless. The fish was tender and cooked well underneath all that crust, so I just kind of ate around it.
My meal was like $30, and that's an awful lot to pay and not love your meal.

I also came to the realization that I HATE the Blue 2o salad. It has cranberries and walnuts in it, and I'm not a fan of either, yet, somehow every time I eat here, I forget that and end up with this nasty salad.

I hate this theater- everything about it.  It's such a dreary, dirty, theater, and the sound is awful. I had the misfortune of sitting in the balcony for a gospel play there, and the sound was so bad, I felt like I wasn't even AT the show.  Luckily, I got the tickets free since I was working at Power 99. I 
feel sorry for people who actually PAY to sit there.

I have been to this theater countless times, and each time, I was always reluctant to go.  At times, I have actually missed out on shows I really wanted to go to because it was at Tower. (Most recently Eric Benet, and the upcoming Janet Jackson concert.)

Went for lunch. I ordered Fish with Black Bean Sauce and my fiance' had the Cumin Chicken. Mine was good, just verrrrry salty and he didn't enjoy his food at all. He said his chicken was too hard and tasted old...not fresh.  Although the food was good, it doesn't quite have the same feel as other Chinese restaurants that give free fried wontons and fortune cookies. It seems more mainstream and commercial. That's a shame, because those are the unique touches that people enjoy at Chinese restaurants.

Visited the University City Sabrina's-- finally!!! Actually, this was my 2nd time there, but we ended up leaving the first time because the wait time was outrageous. Anyway, we just left Sabrina's s after having a fabulous dinner.  This is why Sabrina's is the best Philly has to offer. It doesn't matter what time you go or which location you choose to go to, the food is consistently GOOD!!!!

I ordered the Pan Seared Salmon and my fiance', my favorite dining companion, had the Greek Tilapia.  Both were fantastic, and I expected nothing less.  We liked this location because it was basically empty, and we were able to enjoy a quiet and relaxing dinner.  Our waitress was very nice, and they usually are at all of the Sabrina's locations.

I HAD to update this review because the past year with Freedom has been a nightmare.  My accounts have been tampered with countless times in the past year. Not sure by whom, but according to Freedom, they have detected numerous attempts to hack my accounts and steal my money.  Once they even called me and told me some guy was at Walmart in Woodbury, New Jersey trying to charge things on my credit card WHILE MY CREDIT CARD WAS STILL IN MY WALLET.  How does this happen? 

Needless to say, this was a major inconvenience for me, because EACH time, Freedom treated ME like the criminal by freezing my accounts. I have lost count of how many times I have been at the checkout counter trying to buy things, only to find out my ATM card has been declined.  This is especially unnnerving when I know I've got plenty of money in my account. Once, my card was declined when I was at Dunkin Donuts trying to buy a donut. A DONUT.

The other thing I can't stand about this bank is how long it takes for checks to clear.  The money is not available when they say it will be and they couldn't care less.  I could go on and on, but I have to call their accounting department YET AGAIN to beg for them to release some of my own money to me.

I'm kind of surprised at the bad reviews. Ok, I've only gone to the Farmer's Market on slow days, maybe that's it. If I can't find a parking spot, I don't stop in. I refuse to put money in a meter. So....every time I've gone, the place has been empty, and I'm like, their only customer.  Their muffins are fantastic. Personally, this is my favorite place to go for a huge muffin full of big pieces of real fruit.  I love their muffins. They also have very good ricotta cheesecake. Yes, they're on the expensive side, but you get what you pay for. If you want a cheap, overly-sweet muffin, go to Dunkin Donuts. I truly wish this bakery was on my route to work.

I love this place!!!!!!!  I've been here twice and had the tilapia tacos. The first time I went, I thought the taco was out of this world! The second time.... not so much.  It tasted bland, and like not much effort (or seasoning) was put into it.  So, my opinion is that they can really cook here, but they have off-days depending on how crowded it is.  I enjoyed that first taco so much that I'm willing to keep going there.  

The pastries are sooo good! Both times I had a perfect apricot tart.  This will be a place I go to often.

I still love this place, but I do have a gripe. I ate here on Thursday, and got to the lunch buffet at about 2:30. They had run out of bandh gobi (curry cabbage), which is actually my favorite vegetable there. I waited and waited, but they never replenished it.  I was NOT happy about that because I don't feel like I got my money's worth. A buffet should continue to replace empty trays until the buffet is over or charge less.

OMG..... are they sure it's safe to shop here? The outlets are ok, but I had a hard time geting past the ominous nuclear towers in front of it. Very scary.... but people were shopping, eating, and drinking around it like everything's cool.  I liked the Ann Taylor and Loft outlets, Calvin Klein and my bf liked the Puma, Zumie's and Pac-Sun outlets. I expected to love the Banana Republic outlet, but it was just okay.

I don't see me going there very often. Those towers are just too close for comfort!

Stopped in about 2 weeks ago on a Friday. Had the chicken and waffles. Absolutely NOT a winner.  Please go back to the drawing board. One other thing... the hostess was very unfriendly and did not greet us at all. I actually had to say hello to HER and force her to speak.  When she did, it was very reluctantly. We almost left, but because we were pressed for time, we stayed. She set the tone for what would be a terrible lunch that day.

OMG.... we ate  here this morning for brunch, and it was absolutely AWFUL. I ordered the Salmon Scramble. It was beyond bland, and the fruit that accompanied the entree was old. They use no-name, dollar-store teabags, and the pancakes were disgusting. Their pancakes were the yellow kind (cake batter, maybe?) and they were GROSS. I have had horrible stomach cramps since leaving this place. I'm hoping I don't have food poisoning. Had to stay home from work the next day to recuperate.
This is the place I go to fix my many pairs of tattered shoes and broken heels. It's convenient, but they get a 2 because the Russian woman who owns the place has a bad attitude and a smart mouth.
Went again on Saturday and had the redfish. Not good. It was dry and boring.  Never again! I will stick to the tilapia.

Two people can eat at this buffet for $21.95....that's a HUGE difference compared to the $40 my fiance' and I normally spend when we eat at Indian restaurants.The food is VERY good! I pile my plate high with chicken tikka masala, chicken tandoori, chicken vindaloo, biryani, bhindi masala, basmati rice and naan. Delicious! I have also ordered Tandoori shrimp from their a la carte menu, but the buffet is definitely the way to go.

I know this is a mall spot, but I still like my privacy!! I don't like how they massage you out in the open at this place! Each customer should have their own private area. It makes it hard for me to go into relaxation mode when I can still see and hear conversations of passers-by.

Sooooooo... everyone who loves Indian food knows it's really expensive. I try to get lunch specials whenever possible.  That being said, I went to Saffron for lunch today.I really love their food. It's one of my favorite restaurants in the area. Anyway, when we got there, my fiance asked the guy at the door if we could still get the lunch special. He said YES.  Cool! 

 We sat down and prepared to order. I noticed they only gave us a dinner menu, so I asked our waiter for a lunch menu He told me lunch was over. I looked at the time, and it was clearly 2:30.  So I asked him,"What time is lunch over?"  He answered,"2:30."  Unbeknownst to this guy, I eat here pretty regularly and I KNEW that was a lie.  I decided to look on their website and see what their lunch hours were, just in case they changed their hours or something. My fiance and I agreed that if this guy had lied to us, we would LEAVE and go to Tiffin. 

OF COURSE, the website clearly said lunch was over at 3. We walked right out of the restaurant and decided to take our money elsewhere.   What a disappointment!! Saffron has DELICIOUS salmon and chicken tikka masala, but you know what? So does Tiffin.

The minute we stepped inside of Kitchenbar, my fiance' remarked that it felt like a souped up diner.  At first. I didn't realize what he meant until I observed the wait staff was wearing UNIFORMS!!  None of the waitresses wear uniforms in any our favorite restaurants.  Second, our waitress had a lackluster attitude. She couldn't be more nonchalant. She barely spoke to us as she took our order and delivered our meals.  Third, the music they were playing was HORRIBLE! It seemed out of a place for a restaurant that, judging by the decor, was trying very hard to be hip!  

However, when our FOOD came, there was no mistaking that this was absolutely NOT a diner. We both ordered the Encrusted Tilapia, which was (as described on their website), broiled tilapia encrusted with a blend of portobello mushrooms, sundried tomatoes, crispy potatoes and basil, drizzled with a scampi wine sauce, served with grilled vegetables.  It was soooooo good!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I had been craving a good fish entree, and Kitchenbar delivered.  At 16.99 for our entrees, we thought Kitchenbar was reasonably priced.

For dessert, we had the Banana Caramel Xango, which was absolutely one of the best things I've put in my mouth...ever!!!! Without a doubt, we will return to Kitchen Bar.... there are so many other things on that menu I need to try!
Went today for lunch. Had the salmon burger. Absolutely terrible. It tasted frozen!!!  Our waiter was very nice, so that helped some. Stay far away from the salmon burger. You have been warned!!

This is a horrible McDonald's. I have NEVER had to send my frenchfries back TWICE because they taste bad until I came to THIS place.  After the second disgusting round, I came to the conclusion that this McDonald's just makes bad fries. They were hot, but HARD.  They tasted like they were OLD right after they came out of the fryer.  Well, I probably didn't need those fries anyway.  LOL

Finally, a place with fish that is good as Bonefish!  We had originally planned to eat at Bonefish, but forgot they don't serve lunch, so we ended up at Blue2o by default.  it was fine with me because I always wanted to try this place out. It did not disappoint. I had the Simply Grilled tilapia with spinach and "smashed" potatoes.  My fiancé' had the Mahi-Mahi.  

We stuffed ourselves full of their delicious garlic rolls and salad, and were almost full by the time our food came.  We were so full that dessert was totally out of the question. This is definitely a place I'll return to.

Call me old-fashioned, but I actually preferred Cherry Hill  mall BEFORE the upgrades.  I liked the old food court better, and I definitely liked the fact that the mall was no where near as crowded as it is now.  I remember being able to get a parking spot close to the door (before valet parking stole all of the prime parking spots), and it actually used to be a pretty relaxing experience coming here. I grew up in the area, so I was going to this mall back when Woolworth's was still there, and they had a cafe right outside the store.  

Well, since the upgrades/renovations, it's true, the mall definitely has better stores, but all the crowds (in particular the teenagers), have changed how I feel about shopping here. It's just as bad as shopping at King of Prussia, another place I preferred BEFORE the renovations.  I prefer to do my shopping early in the morning or on weekdays, so I can avoid long lines and annoying customers.

The mall does have some good points, though. One of the best things about this mall is  the restaurants, Inside the mall, Yanagi, in the food court, rivals any other great sushi spot.  I eat there regularly. I also eat at the bistro inside of the mall a lot.  Outside of the mall, you have Red Robin ( a fave of mine), Maggiano's, and of course Grand Lux.  You can't go wrong here, food-wise, because their truly is something for everyone at this mall.

We are regulars here for breakfast. We prefer to visit during the week during our time off, when most people are at work. It is not crowded at that time, and the perfect place to enjoy a nice quiet breakfast.  We prefer the french toast (melba for him, banana walnut for me).  

One of the things I love most is that it's nice and warm in there. It snowed and has been in the single digits this entire week, so the warmth was greatly appreciated. Also, the staff is always friendly. When the french toast I ordered was cold, I asked the waitress to warm it up  in the microwave. Instead, she brought me out a whole new order of french toast. Little things like that keep customers coming back.

I go to Hope's pretty often, usually after gorging on pizza at Peace A Pizza. My favorite, and probably EVERYONE's FAVORITE are the chocolate chip cookies. I also love the white chocolate and double chocolate, and in the fall, Pumpkin Cookies. MMM-mmmmmm!!! At Christmas time, it's the sugar cookies. You can't go go wrong at Hope's.

I live in Philly, but we are moving back to New Jersey soon.  One of the things I know I'll miss about Philly is access to all of the unique cafes I've grown to love. It's nice to know I can get breakfast/brunch that's just as good as those places at the Turning Point. What a great little find.... and quite a surprise, I might add.

My fiance' and I were in NJ house-hunting when we decided to stop for brunch.  We both decided we were sick of all of our regular go-to places in the area (Silver Diner, Grand Lux, etc.) and decided to check for a place we hadn't been to yet on Yelp. Lo and behold, my fellow Yelpers have once again turned me on to a winner!  Turning Point is a great restaurant, for the most part. However, there are some not-so-great things that I need to address.

When we walked in, we thought it was really cute and especially liked how sunny it was inside, courtesy of their sunroom ceilings.It was cozy and charming..... in the FRONT ROOMS, that is.  Unfortunately, the front room was not where we were seated.  Instead, we were led to one of their rooms in the back, where seating was cramped, the floor was wet and sticky, and there was no sun whatsoever. I have to admit, I was a little disappointed because it's such a cute restaurant. That little room in the back is definitely a downer. It's next to the kitchen, it's noisy, and you really feel secluded from the the rest of the restaurant. Normally, this would ruin my entire experience, but the Turning Point WAS able to redeem itself.  

How, you ask?  Well, the food. It's DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!!   I had the OMG, which was "dipped wheat french toast with dollops of pumpkin cinnamon mascarpone, toasted pecans, caramel drizzle and chopped Virginia smoked bacon." My fiance had the Huevos Rancheros, which is kind of his "usual" when we eat out. He said it was the best he had ever tasted, even better than Sabrina's in Philly (which is our favorite cafe for brunch).  

We also ordered fresh squeezed valencia orange juice, and I had a cup of breakfast tea.  The Turning Point also has lots of gourmet hot drinks, such as expressos, hot chocolates and loose leaf hot teas, and cold drinks, such as a variety of iced teas and coffees, smoothies and shakes, and fresh squeezed orange juice (as I said earlier) and lemonade.  

So, yeah... this is really good place to have brunch. You will definitely find something you like on their menu.  Just remember, take my advice and ask your waitress NOT to seat you in the back.  Sit in the front, or better yet, sit outside.

I'm not a big fried chicken person, but the chicken and waffles at The Bistro turned me into one! It was so flavorful and perfectly cooked! The waitress told me it was one of their better breakfast entrees, and she was RIGHT!  

My fiance had the Greek French toast, which was the special that day. He enjoyed his food as well.  The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because it was soooo cold in there every time the door to the restaurant was opened, and we were seated very close to the door.  For this reason, my hot tea and food became cold quickly.

Overall... a great place for brunch, and definitely a place I will eat at again.

I never got over the fact that they changed their original menu. Their original menu had jerk fish, their newest menus (which they keep changing) do not.   I love Bahama Breeze in the summer because of the outdoor porch, live music and drinks. The food is just ok to me.

Very good for a food court restaurant!!!!!  We eat here all the time, and I always get the Salmon Teriyaki.  It comes with 5 California rolls, salmon, rice, and salad.  It's as good as any Japanese restaurant I've been to.
I especially love the salad dressing!!!

Warmdaddy's should change their name to COLDdaddy's. I ate here on Saturday. I ordered the BBQ Salmon, collard greens, black-eyed peas and cornbread- all of which were served ICE COLD. The best thing about Warmdaddy's is the entertainment. They have a singer called "Amazing Grace", and well.... she's AMAZING.

I love Levis!!!  I love this store!  One of the managers there was so helpful last week in helping me find the perfect jeans. I love the way they measure you to determine which cut works best for your figure.  I ended up leaving with 3 pairs of jeans!!

My fiance' and I ate here about 3 weeks ago while out house-hunting.  It was very good, and the staff was very friendly.  My fiance had the salmon teriyaki and I had the salmon bento box with miso soup and some of the best california rolls I've ever had.  This place had so many kinds of sushi, and it all sounded great!  We will definitely be back, especially if we do decide to move to Mt. Laurel.

Just returned from Trolley Car for brunch with my bf.  Overall, not a bad experience. Parking was a a bit inconvenient. They have a parking lot, but it only fits a few cars, and I think 4 of those spots are for takeout only  or they will tow you.  We ended up parking around the corner on Ridge.

The place is cute enough..clean and uncrowded with a tiny dining area. The best seating, in my opinion, is outside, where they have a cute patio area. Unfortunately, it was too cold to eat outside today. 

We ordered Belgian waffles with pecans and bananas. I also had turkey bacon, and my bf had chicken sausage.  They had a special today which sounded delicious, which I kind of wish I had tried... a turkey and apple melt on a croissant. Some other interesting-sounding things on their menu were: a montecristo sandwich, kobe or crabcake sliders, and challah frenchtoast. They also offer omelettes... each topping will cost you $1.00.

The place is ok. It's perfect for eating on the run or after a day of running or biking on Kelly Drive.  I wouldn't go in there expecting to get "full" 
because for the most part, the food is pretty light.

The only thing I didn't like was their selection of tea. They carry Tazo teas, which in my opinion is the worst brand out there.

People say they're expensive, but we thought their prices were average.

yum......

We were planning to go to Le Bus, but a ridiculous wait landed us here. I had a chicken gyro that was out of this world!!!!!!!  Even my bf, who is pretty picky, enjoyed it too!!

The staff was pretty cool too. We will DEFINITELY be back!

The salmon burger was a bit dry for my taste. The "Marathons" used to be my favorite restaurants in Philly, but they have fallen off considerably. The last time my bf and I went to this location, the place was completely empty except for us. I think it was 8:00 on a Friday or Saturday, so that was strange.

I prefer Marathon for breakfast/brunch. They get a little lazy with their lunch and dinner.

Can't tell you how many times I ordered from this place when I lived in Lansdowne. I always got their fried shrimp and fries which was extremely greasy. The fries were shoestring fries, my least favorite.  Cheap quality seafood. I'm surprised this place is still open, but I guess there's not a whole lot of choices for seafood in that area.

So shoot me!  I love the C.F.!!!  Came here last week on a Wednesday night, and the wait was only 20 minutes!!! SCORE!!!!  Got the White Chocolate Raspberry cheesecake, and my slice was teeny-tiny.  NO POINTS for that one!!!

Stuck with my old standby, Salmon Miso, and once again, the Cheesecake Factory didn't disappoint.

One other thing I love about this theater. It's very easy to "movie hop" here. For example, if the movie you choose sucks, you can duck into another one, and there's no one there to really "ride" you and make sure you don't.

You can also park in the lot right next to the theater for a discounted price, which is also convenient.

Not a fan of this place!!!! I went here for a car part for my Infiniti, and members of the staff took their sweet time acknowledging my bf and I. Normally, we leave when we're treated that way, but we really needed that part, so they kind of had us! There were about 4 men standing around and talking and not one of them offered to help us, although it was clear we weren't sure where to go.

I used to go here all the time when I worked at Power 99.  Love their pastries. Especially their apricot tarts and cheese danishes. MMMM good. Last week I bought both of these and spent only $1.50. Beats a Tastykake any day!  Why can't this place be closer to me?  I'd love to stop in here for breakfast on my way to work!!!

I love coming to this Staples.  The guys here are very nice. I am a teacher, and I must spend $500 here each summer, buying everything I need for my classroom.  I have been in this Staples a few times and witnessed difficult customers giving the staff a hard time, but they always show their customers the utmost respect and professionalism.  They seem to really enjoy working here.

First to review! YAY!!!!! I love being first! I can't imagine HOW I can be the first, when this CVS has been in the area for a while now. It IS new, compared to others in the area, but not brand new. Anyway, this is my drug store of choice. You would think all CVS stores are the same, but this is just not the case!  The best thing about this CVS is the self-checkout. I love the fact that I can buy my (ahem) "personal products" without having somebody else know what I'm buying.  Before this CVS was here, I used to send my fiance' to buy them.  LOL.  

Before this CVS came, I was forced to shop at Rite Aid, which is a nightmare in itself. I can't stand a store where the store layout makes no sense to me.  I visit this CVS at least twice a week.
Just left Trolley Car and had the BLATO.... turkey bacon, lettuce, tomato, avocado and onion on a croissant with cole slaw and pickles. Pretty good. I will return......

I just wanted to write a NECESSARY update!!!!  Had to let you all know that the owner of Gianfranco contacted me about my review.  I've had other restaurant owners contact me, but he was the first to show genuine concern. I like that!! (A lot of times, owners will want to argue with you.)

He offered an apology for our dissatisfaction with our pizza, and offered us a free pizza. How cool was THAT???  This is what keeps customers coming back!!!!  

Thanks again, Dali, for being a stand-up guy!!  :)


P.S-  Looooove that ranch chicken pizza!!
Went here today for our annual visit, and OMG!!! Make sure you get an apple fritter when you  visit! They're greasy, but GOOOOOOOD!!!
BANG-BANG CHICKEN AND SHRIMP!!!!! Just one more thing to love at this place!!  YUM!!!!  (Just left here!!) lol

This place is nothing special. I've eaten here enough times to know!  Each time, I end up saying,"Should have gone to Carabba's!"  Or Olive Garden for that matter. The food is mediocre.

The only good thing about this place is its prime location for sidewalk dining.

OK, I see this place is inconsistent. Went again today and had a HORRIBLE slice of BBQ pizza. DISGUSTING. Hard, dried up sauce and tasted like it was a few days old.  So.... Gianfranco's is knocked down a few notches, because I went there at 5:00... dinner time and Old City was buzzing. It was a sunny day, so they should have been expecting customers and had fresh pizza waiting.

They lose MAJOR points for trying to pass off that BRICK I ate today as PIZZA.

Believe alllllll the reviews you've just read about this place!  Ishka's has the best chicken cheesesteaks in Philly!! I'm a very picky eater, so BELIEVE ME!!!!!

I've only ever had a chicken cheesesteak here, so I have no idea how everything else on the menu is. My go-to place for chicken cheesesteaks.

It seems it's time for an update.  Used to like this CVS a lot, but now I feel sort of uncomfortable when I go to to the self checkout.  It's no longer a discreet way to buy your personal items and be on your way. Their new thing is to have a CVS staffer come by and harass you as you're checking out.  Well... it's disguised as "help", but that's not how I view it. Who, in their right mind, needs HELP at the self checkout anymore? They've been around a long time and most people won't attempt to use it without knowing how. That being said.....LEAVE ME ALONE! I don't need a cashier coming over to scan my items for me. If I did, I would have got in her line.  It's annoying and intrusive.  Not a good marketing ploy AT ALL, CVS.

Our waitress  was an A-hole!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   I'm kind of particular when it comes to my chinese food, because I only like CERTAIN chinese vegetables. Apparently, this was a problem for her.  I ordered "Chicken with Black Bean Sauce w/ Vegetables." When I asked her which vegetables came with it, she got a nasty attitude... who knows why.

After we ordered, she continued to be nasty, even though all we did was ORDER our food. She was very cold and short with us, and answered with one word answers, as if each word she spoke was painful to her.

When our food finally came, it sucked!!!  (At least mine did, anyway.)  My bf seemed to like his food, because this is one of his favorite spots to eat in China Town.  As for me, it left a lot to be desired.

If it was up to me, I would never eat there again, but I'm sure I'll be back because a lot of people I know like this place. :(

Are you effing KIDDING ME?  $10.00 for a dry ass piece of salmon, a sprinkling of rice and 2 pieces of broccoli????  I feel like I've been HAD. Seriously!!!  Worse than that, they charged me almost $3.00 for a bottle of tea that should have cost me no more than $1.50.  

Wish I had read the reviews before I wasted my hard-earned money!!!  To top it off, I am STILL HUNGRY!!!! I should have gone to Pei Wei.  On my way to McDonald's right now. SMDH.

Stay away from this place.

Ate here last night with the bf, and surprisingly, it wasn't terrible. We had a great waiter, and my food was pretty good. I only go to Red Lobster for their cheesy biscuits, and I wasn't disappointed.

Also enjoyed the Peach Bourbon Scallops and Shrimp, surprisingly.  This location was clean, the waiter was friendly, and it wasn't overly-crowded.

Used to eat here all the time when I worked at Power 99. I used to always get the chicken and stringbeans which was VERY GOOD. This week, I tried the chicken and broccoli with garlic sauce, and it was terrible. Waaaay too salty for consumption.

I love eating at Sonic.  The food is typical, but the little kid in me think it's so cool to order food from your car and have it brought out to you.  The funny thing about it is, their food really isn't all that good!  I usually stick to a New York hotdog or a Philly cheesesteak when I eat here. I've had also had hamburgers and grilled chicken here. I had a hotdog yesterday.

Their drinks are terrible.  They offer a cajillion different kinds of metallic-tasting flavors you can add to your sodas, slushes and teas, but they all have a bad aftertaste to me. So... why do I come here? it's fun to eat here.  Since I don't live close to a Sonic, it hasn't gotten old to me yet.  I like Sonic. I wish they would put a menu on the passenger side, though, because only the driver can read the menu! I had to have the menu read to me by my fiance', which was kind of annoying.
I used  to stop at this DD all the time on my way to work when I lived in Lansdowne. SUPER SLOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Food is good, but once I ordered fish from them, and discovered my fish was still wrapped in the plastic paper it came from the store in! That means they most likely never cleaned the fish before they cooked it. (Which is pretty gross.!)  I found this out only after I was well into eating my food. I was nauseated after that!!!!  

This used to be one of my favorite jamaican spots, but there's no way I could ever eat there again after that experience.

This review is long overdue. With the exception of ONE cashier here, who as far as I know has worked here for YEARS, the staff here is RUDE!!!!!

OK, first let me acknowledge this nice woman who usually works at the FIRST WINDOW at Wendy's. She's so friendly and upbeat, always has conversation for you, and somehow she always has my change ready for me BEFORE I even pay her!!!  How she anticipates what I'm going to pay her with, I'll never know, but she always has my EXACT change in her hand before I give my money to her. That woman is AMAZING!!

Now on to the rest of the staff here.  One of the managers is a downright a-hole for no reason.  The last time we were there, she was really pissed off because I was ordering in the drive-thru from the PASSENGER SEAT.

She goes into this long spiel about how the drive thru mic/speaker is only meant to to pick up the voice of the driver and blah, blah, blah... Basically, she was telling me to SHUT UP and let my bf do the talking. OK  genius, and how would he know what I want unless I tell him? Dummy!  Her tone was really rude too. I was just on the verge of  putting her in her place, when my bf reminded me this woman was probably mad because she had to work at a dead-end job all day, while WE, on the other hand, were on our way to the beach!!! LOL... sucks to be her, I'm sure!!

The manager is not the only one with issues here.  We've had a few noteworthy experiences, but I'll spare you the details. Pretty much the woman I mentioned earlier is the only one with social skills. She's the reason I gave this Wendy's a 2 instead of a 1.

The staff is really friendly here.  Ate here for the first time after going there to eat and then changing our minds several times (for months).  Each time we went, the place was empty, so we opted to eat someplace else.

I ordered chicken and waffles and my fiance' ordered shrimp and grits. I asked for tenders, NOT wings, What do you think I received?  Huge pterodactyl wings on top of a waffle. I decided to let it go and just eat the wings. Well... they had absolutely NO FLAVOR.  Not a single spice was used to prepare those wings.... not even salt.  I was pretty disappointed. Rather than complain, I just asked for hot sauce and did my best to finish my food.  The wings were fried just right, they just didn't taste like anything.

My fiance's shrimp and grits weren't bad, but the shrimp were super tiny and there was only about 3 of them with a whole plate of grits.  Again, no kind of spice to them.  (I tasted them myself). As someone who typically orders this entree when I eat out, I have to say I was not impressed at all.

We were hoping to make A's our go-to place when we wanted a quick, but GOOD breakfast on the weekend.  It has a lot of potential, but I really need my food to have more flavor for the price.  MAYBE we will give it another try, and order something else.

I live in the area, so we basically eat here like it's McDonald's.  When they first opened, Sardi's could do no wrong.  Now, they are just ok to me. The sides taste kind of bland.  Not sure if this is just because they think they don't have to try any more or what.  Anyway, the best times to eat here are early lunch or dinner when everything is fresh and hot. Try the salmon!

Urban Outfitters used to be the ish!! (This was before the vintage look became so commercial.) Now you can find styles like this in just about every store. Their prices are definitely too high, which may help decrease the chances of bumping into someone else wearing  the same U.E. outfit YOU'RE wearing! lol

This is one of my "go to" spots for jeans, especially Levis.

Wow... NO ONE reviewed this place?  i guess it must be newer than I thought. Stopped in today after buying tacos at the new Mexican spot in the shopping center. My original plan was to go to Coldstone, but I simply CANNOT resist homemade ice cream, so I had to give them a try.   This ice cream is fantastic. I had the pleasure of trying the blueberry pie and party cake ice cream. Wow... this is good stuff.  I also had the opportunity to try some peach and chocolate gelato. OMG.... it's heavenly. Best of all, it's much cheaper than Coldstone. Also, I like that they call one scoop of ice cream a "calf", and two scoops a "cow" size. Very cute.

I hope Crave Creamery gets the business it deserves. It's tucked away in the shopping center where Outback is (right now the name escapes me). This place deserves to do well.

The food was good enough, but they weren't very friendly. We went last weekend. It was 200 degrees in the restaurant, so we ate outside.  They ran out of yams, promised to bring it out to us while we were eating, and never came back.  They tried to placate us with corn on the cob.  It didn't work.  I had out-of-town visitors that wanted soul food that day, otherwise I would have preferred something not-so-heavy on a hot day.  

Not sure if I will return or not.

OMG.... why hasn't this Olive Garden been REMODELED yet? We always order takeout from here, but I haven't dined IN the restaurant in about 10 years.  Today we did, and I can't believe this place looks as beat up as it does!  It is in desperate need of a renovation.  Not only that, they've gotten rid of white grape juice and no longer serve spaghetti as a side with two of the entrees I normally get, but yet, the price is the same.  SO.... how dare they charge the same price for LESS food?

The only saving grace was our waiter. He was really cool, and almost made me forget I wasn't getting my money's worth (almost).  My growling stomach reminded me an hour later.  I think we'll stick to takeout when it comes to this location.

This is NOT Pei-Wei!! The food is much better! Unfortunately, the prices are slightly higher!  lol Anyway, went there today because curiosity was killing me!  I had never read any Yelp reviews for this place, (Didn't realize it was a "Yelp Favorite"!) ,but I have heard a few people say it was good.

Ordered the sizzling salmon w/ black bean sauce. (with peppers, onions, and asparagus.) I have to admit, it was very good.  Also ordered a chicken spring roll. Wasn't too fond of that, so PASS on that if you decide to try Sang Kee.

The place is cute and comfy, and you can stop by Carvel,(Like I did!) When you're done!  Haven't gone THERE in YEARS!

Why is Walmart still in business?!  I go to this particular Walmart every once in a while, because I usually hate Walmart but found this one to be not as bad as the others. I was wrong.  It sure didn't take long for this place to become as deplorable as every other Walmart location.  

I only went this time because I needed a prescription filled that my insurance doesn't cover. A friend told me that I could save money by buying it at Walmart (and I DID save $25.00).  My doctor called the prescription in at 1:00, (afternoon) and I figured if I went at 8:30 p.m., I could run in and pick it up really quickly without having to wait. Wishful thinking!!!!!!

There was a pharmacist and 2 male employees working... or should I say NOT working. The pharmacist was helping a couple in front of me.  I waited in line for 15 minutes (of which NO ONE even glanced in my direction), before I finally called out to one of the lazy employees in the back,"Are you guys open or what?" One of them reluctantly came to help me. He asked for my name about 5 times. I spelled it for him SIX times.  He finally tells me I'm not in the computer.  The pharmacist overhears and then comes over. He tells me,"Oh, your prescription must have been on one of the voicemail messages that were called in. We're backed up, and I have about 10 of them I haven't gotten to." Mind you, there are about 6 customers behind me in line. He tells me it will only be a few minutes. I said,"Okay," and went to sit down and play a game on my phone.  

After about 5 minutes, I look up, and see the pharmacist is waiting on customers. He never went to the back to work on my prescription.  I sat and waited patiently, trying not to think of the impending snowstorm and my 30 minute drive home.  After about 20 minutes, I couldn't take it any more. I stood up and called to one of the guys in the back,"So.... will I get my prescription filled tonight, or what?"  They looked at each other and laughed, and one made a joke to the other in Spanish. The same guy that helped me earlier asked for my name again (and I spelled it for him again about 3 times), and he told me once again it will be ready in a few minutes.  I looked around at all the other customers around me, and only one lady seemed to be bothered by how long it's taking. We started talking, and I found out this was her first time getting a prescription filled there, too. Apparently, the other people were Walmart pharmacy regulars and were accustomed to this substandard treatment.  

Knowing I had lots of time to spare, I walked over to the customer service desk to see if there was a manager I could complain to.  The guy at the desk told me there was a supervisor working at register 4, and that he could could page the manager of the store for me. I thanked him and walked over to register 4. There were about 15 miserable people in line... I was not about to become the 16th!!!  That was just too many for me to get in line to make my complaint! I walked back to the pharmacy, feeling defeated.  There was absolutely nothing I could do.  It was a Friday night, and I would not be able to get in touch with my doctor until Monday for a new prescription.  I was STUCK.  I had no choice but to sit down and wait. On top of that, my phone battery went dead and I couldn't even play my game.

I waited an hour and 26 minutes for my prescription. Considering that they had 7 1/2 hours to have my order ready, it was inexcusable. There were no apologies made WHATSOEVER.  I find it appalling that a company can show its customers so little concern and so much disrespect and still be in business.

Today I went in for a bagel twist, and asked to have it toasted with butter. They told me they will NOT put butter on it. When I asked why, they told me it was not their "Policy."  The woman's tone was extremely rude and argumentative. Not their POLICY????Excuse me??? I didn't realize a policy was needed to put butter on a bagel!!  Every Dunkin Donuts does it.

SCREW YOU HARD, LADY!!!!!

So... I've been hearing people talk about this place over the years, and figured I'd give it a try. OK... don't get the crabcake sandwich OR the soft-shell crab sandwich here.  That's what my fiance and I had, and neither of us was impressed.  My crabcake wasn't awful, just nowhere near what I'm used to. Looking around at what other people ordered, there were probably better options on the menu. I probably would have ordered crab legs if they weren't so overpriced.  We eat out A LOT and I just didn't feel like they were worth the price based on the atmosphere of the place.  We were seated wedged in between 2 other couples and could not even hold a conversation without them looking in our faces and all in our business. I felt uncomfortable and could not enjoy my food at all.  If I ever returned, it would have to be when the place was far less crowded.
Overpriced, sub-standard seafood. Horrible crabcakes and softshell crab sandwiches. Never again.

Get with it already. Other theaters are running circles around this place.  This used to be one of the top theaters in the area, and now I dread going there.  The seats are uncomfortable, aisles are too narrow, patrons are too rude, and picture and sound quality is awful. 

I just spent close to $40 to see a 3-D movie ("The Meg") and could barely tell it was 3-D because their screen is so terrible.  I feel slighted.  
Also, now that other theaters let you buy advanced tickets/seating, it feels almost PRIMITIVE not to have that option.  Snack options are nowhere near as good as the offerings at other theaters, either.

I guess I'm a bit of a movie snob, but theaters are becoming more comfortable and customer-friendly and this one is falling behind.  One of their staff members said this theater will be getting reclining seats soon, so maybe I'll wait until that happens to return.  I've been spoiled by Movie Tavern and Regal Moorestown, so the idea of climbing over people to get to my seat, someone's head in my way and standing in line for tickets seems quite absurd to me now.

Went here last night and got the Zucchini melt. That thing was soooo greasy, and I'm nursing a terrible stomach ache this morning as a result!!  The sandwich tasted ok, but that was DEFINITELY not healthy. It was greasier than any of the fast food I've had, and made me kind of sick too. Not a fan, at least of that particular sandwich.


My boyfriend enjoyed his food. He got the Subji Wrap.  He said his was pretty good because the vegetables were steamed and not fried.

Quite possibly the GREASIEST fast food I've ever eaten!!!! I don't go here a lot, but I'm ashamed to say I HAVE gone here about 3 times this month. Mainly because it's close to the school where I'm working this summer. 

Some things I've had here are the champ burger (too salty), spicy chicken sandwich (edible), the fries, (WAY too salty also), the hot dogs (which I actually think are good!), apple pie, (also good) and the chicken nuggets. (I can only eat 2, and I trash the rest because the salt and spices start to burn my tongue.)

This particular location is super slow at lunchtime.
Ordered a turkey reuben with Door Daash based on another Yelper's review. She was right. It was VERY good!! I will definitely be ordering from here again to try some other things on the menu.

Ate here for the first time last week and had a delicious brunch. We didn't feel like waiting for an hour at the usual brunch spots in the city, so we decided to try Southern Cross. There was no wait and we sat outside on their really cute deck. For some reason, we were the only ones out there. 

I ordered the stuffed French toast (fantastic), and my fiance had the  vegetable omelette. He said the vegetables tasted fresh out of a garden.

The staff was friendly and attentive, and we both agreed we would be back.

I went to this Starbucks for the very last time today. This Starbucks has not been in the area that long, (maybe 2 years), and they have raised their prices 3 times already.  My usual order (tall hot chocolate and banana bread) went from $5.81 to $6.37. The cups have gotten much smaller, but the prices are getting MUCH HIGHER.  That's it for me.  I'll drive a couple lights down and go to the Starbucks in Target from now on. The same order is  still about $5.81 there. This kind of sucks for the employees now because they will probably not receive as many tips.
Smaller cups,yet they are more expensive than the Starbucks down the street. I paid 83 cents more here for my usual order.

Ok,so I caved and started going to this location again. The mobile app lured me back in. It has made getting my daily tea latte a breeze. That is, until today. Today they pissed me off!!!! I ordered my food on the app 25 minutes before I got to the store, and when I got there, my order wasn't ready. I stood there for about 6 minutes before I realized people who ordered after me were getting their food first. When I inquired about my order, I found out some guy named Emilio screwed up and did not make my tea after being asked to do it by one of the people doing the mobile orders. To add insult to injury, after he was called out on his error, Emilio moved at a snail's pace to get it made. I was livid. I ended up spending about 20 minutes in the store, which defeats the whole purpose of ordering ahead on the app. I watched countless people in the store And drive-thru order and leave before me. Thank you, Emilio, for making me late to work today.

I will never ever step through the doors of this restaurant again. I just left there, and was ignored by 4 rude people at their front desk. My fiance and I waited patiently to be acknowledged by someone...ANYONE,  but it never happened. After 6 minutes, it became very clear to us that our business was not wanted or needed, so we turned to leave. I can understand that sometimes restaurants get busy, but a simple,"hello" or "we'll be right with you" would have sufficed. Why take the job if you don't understand the basics? As we walked away, one of the girls at the desk made eye contact with me, said NOTHING and looked back down to whatever she was doing. Clearly, these 3 could use some customer service skills training. For the record, this was at 8:45 PM on July 4th.

We have been regulars at Le Bus for years, and couldn't wait to try this location.   We were among the first customers to arrive for brunch today at 9:15.  When we walked in, the hostess asked us if we had reservations. RESERVATIONS???  I didn't think ANY brunch spots took reservations.  We were accustomed to really long waits at the popular hipster spots, which is why we arrived so early this morning. Anyway.... this was good to know.

I ordered the stuffed french toast rolls and my fiance' ordered the vegan pancakes.  He loved his pancakes, and I thought my french toast rolls were ok.  I think I would prefer regular french toast to the "rolls", but they weren't bad.   

Anyway... I love the decor at this Le Bus. It was pretty cozy. Loved the ambience, as well. I hate a noisy restaurant first thing in the morning, and none of the patrons were being overly loud, as the place filled up.

Service was good, just like the other Le Bus location.

Went again yesterday and asked for the smallest hamburger they serve. (It ended up being a child size/junior. Also asked for the SMALLEST fries and drink they have! This time my bill came out to $7.50...... lol

Had a HORRIBLE lunch here the other day. This is hard to write, because Redstone is a place I normally like a lot.
