The waiter told us we should try their Arctic Char, which is kind of like salmon, but better. So, we did.  Why did we listen to him? I guess they were just trying to get rid of it. It was god-awful!

The fish was absolutely flavorless, no seasoning whatsoever and a chore to eat. Yeah,we DID end up eating it, because as other Yelpers have mentioned, this place is expensive.  

Take it from me.... stay away from the Atlantic Char.

I'm very glad to see that this place is surviving. Went again today with the bf and enjoyed another fabulous meal here: Apple Bourbon French Toast w/ potatos and turkey bacon. DEE-LISH as always. Seems like business is picking up again because there were 3 other tables filled with customers this time when we went.

Once again, I strongly recommend you try this place which, in my opinion is the best in the Roxboro area, and definitely good enough to compete with Honey's or Sabrina's if you want quality food at a good price.

Delicious food EVERY time, and the waiter here is friendly and professional.
YOUR CUPS LEAK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  The girl at the counter gave me 2 of them for my hot drink, and I still ended up with hot liquid all over my clean clothes.

My dining experience at Flavors of India was FANTASTIC! First of all, I'd like to thank the Yelpers who provided pictures of their food with their reviews. The pics are what lured me in... and Flavors of India delivered!  We thought we were going for the buffet, but found out when we got there that there was no buffet that night. We stayed anyway.  I ordered Chicken Tikka Masala  and my fiance ordered Lamb Vindaloo. We also had garlic naan and mango lassis. My food was phenomenal.  I never tasted my finance's because I don't eat lamb, but he said his food was excellent as well.  

The service was excellent.  My finance's dish was really spicy, and the waiter came over and checked on him, almost in amazement that he was actually able to eat it. When my fiance commented that he loves spicy food and eats it all the time, our waiter challenged him by asking him if he wanted to taste something even spicier. Of course, my fiance said yes.  When the waiter returned (with a co-worker), he had a cup of red sauce with him. He told my fiance to taste it, but to only take a little bit because it was THAT spicy.  When he finally tasted it, we all got a good laugh over his facial expression.   It was a lot of fun.  The food was top notch, but that kind of service absolutely guarantees that we will be back.

I could have sworn I reviewed this place! I actually go here mostly for the Grilled Salmon. It's delicious.... it comes with spaghettini and asparagus. I usually get mine blackened.

On the rare occasion that I DO get pizza from here, my favorites are the BBQ Chicken and the Jamaican Jerk pizza.  The funny thing, it actually tastes better when I buy it frozen from Genuardi's than when I get it from the restaurant. 

Overall, an okay place.  I prefer eating outside when I do eat here because the a/c is always tooo cold!

Gave Redstone a chance to redeem themselves tonight, and it's up to par again. I had the Simple Grilled fish ( Cajun salmon), citrus salsa, basmati rice, and grilled asparagus. It was PERFECT.  I'm back to loving this place again.

This was my first time at this location.  We visited at about 3:00 on a weekday.  I had the chicken tacos and my fiance' had the fish tacos.  Both were delicious.  Not a fan of the refried beans, which were a bit on the salty side.

FANTASTIC Chicken Mole tacos.  I can't believe I got something this good from a TRUCK.  Do yourself a favor and ignore the truck parked directly next to this truck. I made the mistake and went to THAT truck because the line was shorter.  Now I know that it's absolutely worth it to wait.

Redstone is my new favorite restaurant!!!!!!!!!  Ate there on Thursday at about 4:00 and caught the lunch specials. I ordered their Grilled Salmon and citrus salsa with rice pilaf and grilled vegetables. My bf ordered the Rotisserie Chicken Salad. For dessert, we ordered the Stone's Chocolate Cake, which was moist and delicious!!!

Loved the decor of the place. When you walk in, the aroma of the grill hits you IMMEDIATELY... and that's a good thing! 

The only bad thing was that the floor near the kitchen and bathroom was kind of greasy. I could feel my sandals slipping on it as I walked. And... speaking of bathrooms, it was a nice one, but it was dirty, and there was no tissue in two of the stalls. (Hence, FOUR STARS instead of FIVE!!)  For the prices they charge, you would expect them to stay on that. They had tons of employees standing around doing NOTHING near the hostess desk, so there was  no excuse for that.

Their food was FANTASTIC, and I will absolutely go back! I loved their outdoor patio, so next time, we'll sit outside. It was 100 degrees outside when we went, so that really wasn't an option!

Ate here again today for brunch, and for the LIFE of me, I can't figure out why this place isn't crowded!! What's wrong with you Yelpers???  lol Seriously.... other than my bf and I, there was only one other person eating there this morning.

Their food is STILL delicious!! I have ordered takeout  (dinner) from here about 4 times, and their dinner is just as good as brunch. Well, that's too bad for the rest of you if you'd rather waste your time waiting an hour for a table at Morning Glory or Honey's.  In my opinion, Urban Cafe is better than BOTH of them.  AND it's CHEAPER!!!!!

Today I had a crab omelette with tomatos, spinach, onions,  and swiss cheese, potatos, and wheat toast. My bf had their fench toast with apple bourbon sauce. Everything was SPOT ON... perfect!!!  

Hands down... the best crab omelette in Philly is at Urban Cafe.

Just got takeout from there tonight. I have to give Urban Cafe 5 stars, because their Baja Salmon was soooooo good!  It was a special, but it needs to be added to their menu.

Their bread pudding is absolutely HEAVENLY!!!!!  What a perfect meal!  I'm ready for a NAP now!!!! lol

Went again on Thursday, this time to try out their new Roxborough location. I'm not crazy about the area, but the place is much better looking than their last.  The inside looks better as well, and they have WORKING a/c now!!

We ordered Salmon, which was their special that night. It had sundried tomato and basil, and had mashed potatos and french cut, well-seasoned green beans.  DELICiOUS!

Still love this place!

I like Victoria's. We ordered takeout there tonight after attempting to eat at Delilah's at 30th street (closed down), and Chef Ken's (closed on Tuesdays.) I'm happy to say I really enjoyed my food. had the fried tilapia, macaroni and cheese, and collard greens.  I was surprised to find I didn't need to add any additional spices (not even salt or pepper) to my food.  

My fiance', on the other hand, thought it was just okay. He got the short ribs, and was a bit confused when he discovered they came with no bbq sauce.  Who eats their ribs that way?

Service was prompt and friendly.  In fact, we were out of there within 5 minutes of ordering, and my food was fresh and hot. (Unlike other places, my food was made fresh.)  I would definitely recommend Victoria's, especially on a Tuesday night.

My hamburger was waaay too salty!!!Ordered a Giant, thinking it was like a Big Mac.... instead it had 3 burger patties on it. Ended up taking off 2 of them.  

I like their menu choices. I love that you can order your hamburger the way you like it, "5 Guys" style.  They're not as good though. Or maybe I just ordered the wrong thing.

Loved the fries and the idea that their food is made to order. it's also kind of cute inside.  Thought they should have had a drive-thru like the old Gino's in my hometown did, but I guess they want an excuse to charge you more money by pretending to be different than a fast food joint.

Overall, it was ok, but I'm sure it will worsen as times goes on and more franchises pop up.  Way too expensive for what they serve there.

This place is totally revamped! It's brand new, and has a more modern decor. You can tell business has picked up since when i was next to Boston Market. The clerks wear big, goofy taco hats on their head, and they are more careful about getting your order right. To speed things up, they give you your condiments at the pay window.

Well, their new marketing must be working! I've been there twice this week. I got the Dorito Taco with salsa verde.

My bf and I tried Dahlak for the first time last week. He loves Ethiopian food, but it was my first time trying it. I wanted to order the Fish Wat, which is stewed fish in a spicy "berbere" sauce, but thought I better go with something I KNEW would be safe. I'm not really a "HOT/SPICY" food kind of person.  

So... I went with the Fish Alicha, which is described on their website as:
"fresh fish with fresh lemon and simmered in a mild herb sauce served with a hard-boiled egg ."  Well.... I didn't see any "hard-boiled egg", but the fish was pretty good. I have no idea what the sides that came with my fish were, (my bf said iit was beans of some kind) ,but it was served with injera bread and a few pieces of lettuce.   

For dessert we had the Baklava, which was ok, but kind of on the hard side, like it might have been old.  The service was good, and our waitress was attentive.  I could see myself going back again, but I would ask for some other side, maybe the collard greens.

Went to this location yesterday with about  9 other family members for a late brunch/lunch.  The food was okay, but definitely oversized and overpriced.  My mother, fiance and I had the chicken and waffles.  When it arrived, I was instantly sorry I didn't take our waitress' advice and share it.  It wasn't the best I've had.... the chicken was kind of bland and flavorless.  There were 2 massive pieces of it, but I could barely finish one.  It was ok, but in my opinion, the best Chicken and Waffles in the area is at  The Bistro at Haddonfield or the Silver Diner.  The chicken and waffles at Hash House has the potential, it just needs to be doctored up some.  It is served with what appeared to be fried onions, tomatoes, and a stalk of rosemary.  It still needed something else with kick, so I peppered mine up and added a splash of hot sauce.  

My niece ordered the shrimp and grits, which she said was good, but kind of "lumpy." LOL.   One sister had the Portabella Mushroom sandwich, and my three nephews and dad had burgers.  They all seemed to enjoy their food as well, but no one was blown away.

My other sister had the crabcakes.  They weren't visually appealing to me, and she said they were just ok, and she would never order them again.  

My main take-away from this experience is that their food does not seem very "personalized."  When my chicken and waffles came, it was cold. That made me feel like it was "mass produced" rather than cooked individually and upon ordering.  I think the next time I come, I will probably order some fish from the dinner menu.  The breakfast is just too MASSIVE and too expensive for what it is.  It was very cute inside and our waitress was wonderful, though.

The only negative thing I have to add is that one of the managers came over and started clearing plates off of our table without even asking us if we were done. She started at the end of the table where the children were sitting and never said a word... just started taking dishes away.  We made a complaint as we were leaving, but I'm making another one now. We spent a lot of money yesterday and tipped well. Needless to say, we didn't appreciate being rushed away so rudely.  I'm hoping someone with higher authority will reiterate to her how important it is to treat customers with dignity and respect.

Here in the ER with my fiance for the past few hours. There are tons of hacking, mask-wearing sick people around me and dried up blood on the floor. The cleaning lady swept the floor while I was sitting here, but I guess dried up blood on a hospital lobby floor is perfectly ok.

BELIEVE the 5 star reviews about this place.  We are fairly new to the area and ended up here after the Juneteenth Festival was rained out and we were unable to get food from the vendors. We did a Yelp search and saw that people seem to LOVE it. Well.... we did, too.  

I ordered the pineapple jerk chicken, mac and cheese and collard greens. I can say WITHOUT HESITATION that all three were the best I've ever had. My fiance' ordered the turkey wings, mac and cheese and collard greens. The mac and cheese tasted like it was made from a lot of different cheeses and had just the right top lightly-crunchy layer.  The collard greens had just the right spicy kick, and had red and green peppers and onions.  DELICIOUS!   The jerk chicken was just the right blend of sweet and spicy... and had chunks of pineapple.  On top of that... it was UNBELIEVABLY tender.

We eat out A LOT... and it is really hard to impress us with soul food. However, this place did JUST THAT. To say it is a HIDDEN GEM in BURLINGTON is an UNDERSTATEMENT.  Five well-deserved stars.

This library LOOKs great, but looks can be deceiving.  First of all, I'm sure you've read the other reviews and already know its good points: the snack bar, the outdoor seating, lots of tables with electric sockets, tons of videos and books, etc., but I have a few gripes about this library.

First... it's NOISY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Ridiculously noisy.  In fact, the librarians are the noisiest people in the place. Everyone in this place is noisy, so don't ever think this is a quiet place to get some work done. You will need to have ear buds and turn your music up all the way in order to drown out all the noise.

Second.... it's FREEZING. I was in there today and had to leave because its 56 degrees outside, (October 14th) and they actually have the air conditioner on!!! Not just today, but most of the time, this place is too cold. Definitely makes it hard to concentrate when you are shivering and wearing a coat and hood. And it wasn't just me...quite a few people had on their hoods.  That should tell SOMEONE in charge that it's too cold in there.

Third....the ladies room smells...bad....all the time. Do they clean it or empty the trash? It just smells unclean.

Fourth.... slow/sketchy wifi.  For some reason, the signal seems to go in and out.  That's no good for me when I'm doing work on my computer that involves using a data system that has to maintain internet connection or it will not save your work.  

So...even though I love the LOOKS of Cherry Hill Library, it's just not comfortable for serious working and research for the aforementioned reasons.  I usually go to Burlington County, Moorestown or Willingboro libraries because they are much more conducive for really digging into your work.
Returned a few days ago and we both had the pan-seared salmon with sweet potato, corn, and bacon hash. It was very good....good enough for me to return.

The food is very good here!  I've had the steamed shrimp with corn, broccoli and potato. It's delicious, but LOADED with butter!  Maybe a little too much, really. I'd prefer to get my butter in a container and then use as little or as much as I want.

Other than that, no complaints!

Have you had their fried chicken?OMG... I almost NEVER order fried chicken at a restaurant, but the girl at the table next to me ordered it, and it looked delicious, so I decided to as well.  It came with mashed potatos, jalapeno cornbread (which I LOVED), and I ordered spinach with mine.

My food was soooo good! Silk City was already one of my favorite places to eat. but the buttermilk chicken just solidified it for me.

My bf and I eat here from time to time, preferring it over the fast food offered in the Plaza food court of KOP mall.   Unless you go pretty early in the afternoon, a lot of the food served here is old and dried out. (Speaking mostly about the chinese food and the bistro-style food.)

Today, we went right at lunch time, and the food was actually pretty fresh. I had the cajun tilapia with mac n cheese and vegetables.  There was some kind of special which also offered caesar salad (which I didn't touch because it has way too much salad dressing!) and for dessert, your choice of pudding.

Overall, it wasn't too bad. The pudding was actually very good...

I prefer this location over the one on Fairmount. A lot of pretentious people go to that one. The one in Manayunk was cool.  We ordered empanadas, which DID NOT fill me up one bit, but they were pretty good!

Ended up going to lunch at the mall immediately after, which you don't expect to have to do  right after breakfast. LOL

Again, we thought the experience was ok, and it's pretty close to us, so we'll be back.

This is my favorite theater. I live close to both Movie Taverns in PA, but I like this theater the most because of the comfortable seating and the way you don't feel have to feel like people are sitting on top of you. I wish there were better choices as far as snacks go.

Ate here again today, and my food was terrible. Truly tasteless fish, collard greens AND mac and cheese. I couldn't believe it. Mind you, it HAS been a while since I last ate here.  Back then, I loved the food here. Why have they stopped using SEASONING??  I don't get it!

Today.. all that has changed. This food was BLAND and cost me $20 for a fish platter and a miniscule slice of DRY red velvet cake. 

I'm very disappointed and wish I had spent my money elsewhere.
The Silver Diner has risen from the ashes!!!  Went again last weekend and had the veggie scrambler, potatos and silver dollar pancakes.DELICIOUS!!!!!!!  Welcome back, Silver Diner!

Bonefish has  FANTASTIC food every single time, but that's not what this review is about. The bone of contention is that this Bonefish does NOT have hot water in their bathrooms.This is pretty serious to me. It means that their cooks, waiters/waitresses cannot adequately clean their hands (neither can customers, for that matter). I find this troubling.  I have been going to this Bonefish since it opened, and we dine there at least twice a month, and the water has been ICE COLD every single time, so no one can tell me it was a temporary issue. For the life of me, I cannot understand why this doesn't concern anyone there. My low rating will stand until they correct this problem.

I've never had an apple dumpling before. Best believe I'll be returning to D.E.P. for more!  Easily one of the best apple desserts I've ever tasted. 

Perfect apples... not too hard, just the perfect amount of sweetness and heated to perfection, topped off w/ a mound of whipped cream. Heavenly!

Went to Seasons because the wait for Capital Grille was almost 2 hours. The wait for Seasons was only 1 hr, so we went with it.

We went last night, and it was freezing outside, so I liked the little pseudo-fireplace they had in the waiting area. The restaurant was warm and cozy inside. My bf and I enjoyed the live music from the piano bar.

Our waiter, James, was great!  Started off with an Organic Greens salad and stuffed mushrooms. The salad was good, but I've had better mushrooms.

I ordered scallops with cous-cous and asparagus. The asparagus was too chewy.  The scallops weren't bad.  My bf ordered grouper. I would have rather had his dinner than mine.

Finished it off with a carrot cake sampler and an English breakfast tea.

Dinner was ok, but kind of overpriced, and I was still hungry when I left.

Went to Roly Poly for the first time today. I ordered a Hot Pressed sandwich. When they say "pressed", they really mean it! It's a flattened, toasted sandwich with various ingredients inside of it. I got a #52, which is a Hickory Chicken with cheddar cheese, onions, bacon, mushrooms and bbq sauce, with a side of ranch dressing.  Also got some pasta salad, chips, and a brownie.  

The sandwich was pretty good. Like I said, it's very flat, so it's kind of like a panini or quesadilla but with different ingredients.  I was glad I got a whole instead of half a sandwich. I'm not sure if half would fill me up.

Roly Poly also has Maryland Crab Soup (but they were out of it today), and different kinds of salads. I can see this being one of my go-to spots if they are open on nights and weekends because they do have local delivery.

"Chain restaurant" does not always equal "mediocrity".  Brio is a perfect example of that. This was the first time my fiance' and I had been to this location. We arrived at 11:30 am on a Friday, and we were the first ones there. Sometimes, this can be a bad thing at restaurants. Often times, you run into waiters/ waitresses that aren't quite ready to start their shift just yet, and are irritated by the very sight of you. Not at Brio. We were greeted enthusiastically the minute we walked in. We had about 3-4 different people come over to our table to tell us the specials, offer us drinks, or just to say hello.  It was nice, and made us feel welcome.

We began, as always, with the Lobster Bisque, which was perfect.  I ordered the Salmon with Angel Hair Pasta, and my boyfriend ordered the Chicken Pomodoro Classico.  Mine was good, just a little buttery, and my bf's was good, but a little on the salty side.  For dessert, we both had the bread  pudding with gelato.  My bf's was better than mine, because somehow I ended up with the endpiece of the bread.  

I think the reason I enjoyed our lunch at Brio today was because we were both playing hooky from work, and the atmosphere of the restaurant fit my mood. It was relaxing.  There was a nice breeze blowing through the restaurant because they had the windows/doors open, and there were no loud patrons cackling in the background to kill my mood. Overall, a very good lunch.

Went there twice in the past month, and I'm happy to say they've got a new menu!!!  Had a crabcake benedict last time which was MUCH too salty, but could have been good if a different cook had made it! LOL

Last night, had the Cajun Salmon and Eggs. My eggs were BLAH, but I think maybe the same cook may have been working.

I still like the Silver Diner. I would, however, FIRE the server who insisted upon singing "Sweet Home Alabama" at the top of his lungs. UGH.How irritating!
Famous Dave's is ok. I usually get the bbq chicken sandwich, baked beans and coleslaw. Not bad.......

My fiancé and I had lunch here today, and we loved it.  We walked past lots of times during our Christmas shopping and always said we would be back to eat there during the summer so we could sit in their lovely patio area. Well, today was the perfect day for it--not too hot, not too cold.

My fiancé had the Swordfish Grigliata which was very spicy, way too spicy for me, but he enjoyed it.This was swordfish and tomatos on a skewer and served with fettucine with a spicy marinara sauce.I had the Crab and Shrimp-Crusted Tilapia with potatoes and roasted vegetables. It was a special today. I also had the Chopped Salad and a bowl of Lobster Bisque, both were very tasty.The bisque was just right, and didn't hurt my stomach at all like other bisques I've had.

For dessert, I had a carrot cake dolchino-- it was a little too creamy, but edible.

This rating is for the DELIVERY.  We ordered a sectional.  When my sofa came, they brought only the SMALLEST section.  The chaise.... big enough for one person to sit on. When I called to complain, they said they told us beforehand that they were only bringing part of it (LIARS).  My fiance' took the day off to wait for this thing, and we were LIVID that they had the nerve to bring it in pieces. Now one of us has to take an ADDITIONAL day off to wait for the other piece.  Saw lots of other complaints about deliveries online. Apparently, this is the norm for them.

What has happened to this McDonald's?  The place is looking like a dump these days, and the employees flat out don't care!!  Today I ordered chicken mcnuggets with hot mustard and a sweet tea with lemon. I got nuggets with BUFFALO SAUCE, and an unsweetened tea with NO ICE. It was about 100 degrees, and they really served me a drink with no ice.  Where is the manager, and why isn't anyone checking for quality customer service any more?
One more reason to love Silk City..... their Shrimp and Grits is soooooo goood!!!!!!

We eat here every so often, but it's really just ok to me.  For breakfast, I get either:Mama's French Toast Breakfast or Mama's Pancake Breakfast, which is french toast or pancakes, with 2 eggs. (make mine scrambled w/ cheese and onions), and turkey sausage.  It's ok, but nothing special. They NEVER give you enough syrup here for some reason. 

For dinner, I've had: Chicken N Rice, (Bland! Doesn't taste homestyle AT ALL!!!!), Country Fried Steak, (So-so), Country Fried Shrimp (Edible!), and the Haddock DInner. 

For my sides, I typically order: corn, okra, maccaroni and cheese, mashed potatos, fried apples or cole slaw.  

Their desserts are ok too: Apple Dumplings w/ icecream or fruit cobbler are my favorites.

The worst part about this place are the kids. Yeah, I said it.... I'm a teacher, but when I'm NOT at work, keep your screaming, bratty kids out of my sight!!!  Feels too much like working!!!  LOL
I get the buffalo shrimp here or chicken fingers. Their wings are average. Good sauces and convenient location, (For me, anyway!) lol I try not to eat here too often because of the grease.

(Boston market) They actually ran out of chicken yesterday right when I went to place my order.They told me it would be a 20 min. wait, and offered me a free drink while I waited. Well, while I was waiting... lots of customers started piling in after me and as luck would have it, they were ordering chicken as well. 

So, 20 minutes passed and I could see the people who came in AFTER me starting to form a line at the register. Thankfully, the manager remembered that I was the first person in line (even though I wasn't standing in line) and called me first.  OMG... the crowd went CRAZY!!!  Mind you, they had to know I was waiting before them because I was in the restaurant BEFORE them!! Utter chaos!

The manager gave my bf and I one piece of free chicken to compensate for my waiting and aggravation. When I got it, though, it was UNDERCOOKED. BLAH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I just got over e.coli last week and I'm not trying to get sick again!!!  Didn't touch the chicken.

I appreciate the manager's efforts, but I'm sorry, this places gets a ONE for being unprepared and then offering me half-done chicken after all of that waiting. I don't care if it WAS free. It was GROSS.
The Buffalo Chicken salad is DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!! Yum! I like that or the the BBQ chicken salad, along with a whole grain roll and apple juice. If the soup of the day is good, I grab one of those too.

I love China House!!  Their General Tso's Chicken and Chicken and Broccoli are the best! Their portions are in smaller containers than most chinese restaurants. I would think that would make them lose business, but I guess people don't mind because everyone I know loves this place!

Yelp brought me here!! I'm new to Cinnaminson. I'm a Jersey girl that lived in Philly for a while and then found her way back home. I agree with the Yelper a few posts down...this area is definitely lacking when it comes to good cafes. It's what miss most about Philly.  I am so excited to have discovered Jeny's!!

I've visited twice and ordered an English Breakfast Tea Latte and an apple cinnamon muffin.  My muffin was soft and fresh and not overly sweet. Jenny made my tea latte nice and frothy...just how I like it. Also, I saved $2.00 eating here instead of my usual Starbucks run. This is my new spot!!! It's super-cute, and right around the corner!!!
Perfect slices any time of day!  Other pizza places need to take notes!

I was the first person to review this place.  I used to eat here all the time back when I worked at Power 99, which was on Domino Lane at that time.  Almost everyone at the station ordered from this place because they were THAT GOOD.  Wellll... times have changed.  I guess they've changed owners, because this place hasn't been good in YEARS.  I felt I needed to update because I did not want to be the reason people ate here and hated it.

I used to love the general tso's, chicken with vegetables, shrimp fried rice, and egg foo young.  None of these are good anymore.  They use plastic containers which make the chicken chewy and hard by the time you get it home.  The metal containers they used to use were much better for keeping the food hot and fresh. Nevertheless , I kept going here because I still hadn't found a place I like better... until now.  I won't say the name of the place here because I do not want to ruin their business, but they need to step it up.  The food is not nearly as good as it was.  This comes from someone who was a loyal customer for about 14 years.

I went to a screening for producer, Lorenzo Ferguson's documentary "Making Skybreak" at Philly Cam this week and Eatible Delights was the caterer.  We weren't expecting there to be food at this event, so we were pleasantly surprised when there was.

I was IMPRESSED.  They brought all kinds of fresh fruit and cheeses on one tray, a tray of grilled vegetables (seasoned well), pasta salad, meatballs, and 3 different kinds of wings.  The food was DELICIOUS!! I had to grab a card to make sure to remember them when and if I ned a caterer.  Everything was really good. Everyone at the event commented on how nicely the food was displayed and how great the food was. Great job, Eatible Delights!

I like this cute little shop.  Stopped in the other day for a hot fudge sundae. I am lactose intolerant, but I am able to eat small amounts and be ok.  I asked the girl at the counter for the smallest size they serve. That ended up being a little less than a scoop, and I was fine with that.  My sundae was very good. 

My fiance ordered a Brecken Schmecken... which is actually what I should have had. This was kind of like a caramel sundae with pieces of a soft, cinnamon sugar cookie inside.  Yummy.

I enjoyed my food here, but the service was terrible. When we walked in the place, we had no idea what to do or how the place "worked", and no one was courteous enough to help us. In fact, the staff just stared at us. No greetings were made, no instructions given, just DUMB STARES. In fact, the patrons were staring at us too. I actually felt kind of stupid.

Finally, my bf figured out that you're supposed to go the counter to order.  The asian guy at the counter was kind of nonchalant. My bf said to him,"How is your veggie burger made?"  The guy kind of gave him a blank, expressionless stare and said,"What do you mean?"  My bf picked up on his attitude immediately, but kept his cool. He responded,"I mean, just what I said! How is it made? Is it a patty, is it grilled vegetables on a bun? I mean, HOW IS IT MADE??"   So... the guy just kind of points to the wall where the menu is. My bf was like,"I read that. I'm asking YOU." Finally, the guy says,"It's kind of like a patty." Okaaaaay... whatever that means!

So, next, it;s my turn to order. I ordered the fish burger. I had a few questions of my own, and got the same frosty treatment.  When he asked me if I wanted my fries spicy or plain, I asked him what kind of spices are on the fries. He goes,"What do you mean?"  Did I ask him a complicated question??  I answered,"I MEAN what kind of spices? Is it seasoned salt, garlic, pepper, hot sauce, onion powder.." I ran down a whole list of options because the guy was obviously remedial. He reluctantly muttered,"I'm not sure."  So, I went with the plain fries.

We sat down and contemplated walking out of the place. We've been known to do that. (Order and roll out, if we aren't feeling the place)  We decided to be "nice" and stay. 

Although the place is cute inside, we decided to take our food home. The staff was just too weird for me, and in desperate need of socialization!

The fish sandwich was actually pretty good, and I loved the fries. What ruined this place for me was the retards who work here.  Burger.Org could earn a solid 4 stars if they restaff.

Unlike most people who like to stay inside their cozy homes during a snowstorm, my bf and I love to venture out and enjoy the empty stores and restaurants and less cars on the road. Yesterday was no exception. We decided to go for brunch at Le Bus in Manayunk, but there was a wait, so I suggested we check out Bourbon Blue instead.

The place was empty alright, but that suited us fine. Thankfully, it was warm inside, but a little drafty near the windows. We loved the decor of the restaurant.

We both decided to go with the Crabcake Benedict. I also ordered tea, and was surprised to find out that they didn't offer herbal tea. MOST of the brunch spots we go to do have a nice selection of teas. I went with plain old Lipton tea, and my bf had coffee.

When our food came, it looked delicious. After the first bite, we discovered it WAS delicious, however it was ICE COLD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  On a cold day, the last thing I want to eat is cold eggs.  I called the waitress over, and asked if our food could be warmed up. She told me,"Unfortunately, we don't have a microwave, so we would have to make the whole entree over again."  Seriously?? What restaurant in this day and age doesn't have a microwave?


We toyed with the idea for a minute as she went to find a manager, and decided we didn't really want to wait another 20 minutes for our order.  The waitress returned a minute later without a manager, but said they would make the order over. We told her not to bother, and ate the ice cold meal anyway. We also ordered a pumpkin pancake which was also very good, but again.... COLD.

For the life of me, I can't figure out how our food had a chance to get cold when there was only 2 other tables of guests in the place.   Very disappointing.  Too bad... because if it was warm, that would have been one of the best Crabcake Benedicts I have ever had.  The hollandaise sauce was just right, and my eggs were cooked to perfection. The potatoes were delicious, and my pancake was fantastic, in spite of its iciness.

Overall, we decided we like Bourbon Blue, but we won't go there again on a cold day. I won't do cold eggs again, sorry! By the way, I would have given Bourbon Blue a 4, possibly a 5, if my food was even a tad bit warm.

If I had to choose a chain of stores I DESPISE other than Walmart, it would be Rite-Aid. The store's layout makes absolutely no sense, and I always find myself wandering around aimlessly and spending way more time in there than I planned to.

This is the location I find myself in most often, and usually because I was dragged in by someone else. Meh.

Found out about this park by accident.  My fiance' and I were near Gilbertsville, having dinner at The Brick House, and decided to look on our GPS for attractions. Being a former Brownie and Girl Scout, I'm kind of a "nature girl" at heart, and thought it would be cool to see this park. 

It definitely was! This place is GORGEOUS! On the day we went, the weather was perfect! We drove with the top down and enjoyed a pleasant drive with the sun on our skin and the smell of fresh cut grass and flowers in the air. The drive there was an experience in itself!

I'm afraid the pictures of this place really don't do it justice. This is a quiet, peaceful park, with plenty of pretty scenery to look at.  Upon seeing the trails, we wished we had brought our bikes, but took a leisurely stroll around the park instead. It was such a relaxing place, and the perfect way to end our evening after a nice dinner.

Ate here again and had a baked salmon frittata. I wasn't very impressed. It was cooked too much around the edges and was too crispy for me. My potatos were hard, and my tea was served lukewarm, just like the last time I was here. At first, I thought it was a one-time incident, but now I know they just don't serve their drinks hot. My fiance's cafe au lait was lukewarm as well.

Overall, I still like this place, but I will never order the salmon frittata again.
I ate here last weekend on my way back from Christiana Mall. My food was NOT GOOD. I ordered the BBQ cheeseburger and it was dry and boring.Honestly, I wish I had just stopped at McDonald's.
A great place to go if you love natural soaps and lotions as well as shea butters and different kinds of oils!!! I'm so late discovering them, but it will definitely be one of my go-to spots now!

If you get takeout, don't forget to ask for your butter, cocktail sauce/tartar sauce, and some plasticware or crackers to open your crab legs.  I left with none of these, and fought with my crabs for 1/2 hour before I finally just gave up after getting my fingers cut!!

If you have ever been to Movie Tavern, you won't like this place at all.  NO stadium seating and the chairs do not lean back.  Also, when you book tickets, the system does not allow you to skip seats, which means in some cases, you are elbow to elbow with other people.

I have to agree with Eric B. This was one noisy theater.  It has been about 10 years since I have been to a movie at 69th Street. As soon as the movie started, it dawned on me. The patrons here never SHUT UP.  Not only that, they talk on cell phones and text all throughout the movie, and the light from their phones prevents you from enjoying the movie. There is also a loud beeping that occurs maybe every 5 minutes. Not sure what it is, but I'm guessing the fire alarm?  My ears are super-sensitive, so I found it very irritating and so did my fiance'.

Oh, and I saved the best for last. This theater has MICE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  One crawled past my feet, and I screamed bloody murder. I had to sit with my feet up for the rest of the movie. DISGUSTING!!!!! Thankfully, I had a Groupon, and only paid $5 for my ticket.  Add this to the fact that there was no toilet paper or soap in the ladies room, and I can say with certainty that I will not return here.

Ps....make sure you read all the interviews in the "not recommended" section for more information.  Those reviews involve credit card fraud by employees, police harassment, more mouse tales and other exciting tidbits.

I like KOP, but I hate the look of the new food court!!!  It used to have a pit you could step down into, but for some reason, they have opted for a new "cafeteria style" look similar to Cherry Hill Mall.

Another thing I have always hated about this mall is how you have to walk outside to get from the Court to the Plaza. You would think by now they would have found someway to conjoin them. I mean, really... it's a pain in the winter.

Still one of my favorite chain restaurants! So glad this place opened down the street and around the corner from my house! Thank God... another option for take-out besides cheesesteaks and McDonald's!!  If you've never been to Joe's, you're in for a treat.  My favorite thing here are the steampots, preferably Joe's Classic Steampot with extra shrimp instead of sausage. I find a lot of their other entrees claim to be "blackened", but are really just seasoned with a lot of salt, especially the blackened tilapia and the Snapper Ponchartrain.  I can see myself visiting this location at least once a week.
I hate Starbucks, but I like this location!!  It's so cozy!!  Also love their pumpkin scones!!  DELICIOUS!!! Their vanilla chais suck, but I love their strawberry smoothies!

This is one of my favorite places to go to run because I love the track. I first started using it when I attended Saint Joe's.  I live in the area, so it's like having my own track to work out on. My fiance and I prefer early mornings or late nights. That's when there are less people and we can practically have the track to ourselves. The only thing that sucks is when the students return and we have to walk or run on the sidewalk near the track because they are using the track.

Over-priced tourist trap!!!!!!  I've been here many times, and the entrees are mediocre at best.We've gone basically for the atmosphere. It's a fun place to eat.  

The best thing about it is the dessert. When my bf and I eat here, we eat dessert FIRST and then have lunch or dinner. I love their hot fudge brownie w/ icecream.

Wow... what a beautiful place to have brunch! My bf and I had been to Terrain before, but not to the cafe. We finally checked out the cafe last weekend and we enjoyed it!

I had the Brown Butter Pancakes with Vanilla Whipped Cream and my bf had the Challah French Toast, Carmelized Apples and Vanilla Whipped Cream.  We both enjoyed our food. I also had a Vanilla Honey Tea Au Lait which was served lukewarm.  Since it was pretty warm last weekend, I didn't mind. If it was cold outside, I would have sent it back.  It was very good!

I liked the added touch of the bread in the flower pot, but could have done without the butter it came with. It had hard pieces of sugar (or was that salt?) that hurt my teeth.

I wish Styer's had more choices for sides to go with their pancakes, that would be my only complaint. I can see this being a place we go to often this summer.

OMG..... I love Joe's, but THIS particular location SUCKS.  They are SUPER SLOW and unorganized. Made the mistake of going there for takeout on Saturday. The place was a MOB SCENE, and apparently, the staff was not prepared for it.  As I stated, I called ahead for takeout, and waited an hour and a half for it.  Ridiculous!!!!!!!!!  The wait time to EAT IN the restaurant was 2 hours, so basically I wasted my time calling in.  

When they brought me my food, my order was wrong, which led to ADDITIONAL wait time. I attribute this to the RETARD that took my order over the phone. She acted like she was totally unfamiliar with the menu and kept putting me on hold to ask someone around her a question. I doubt my order was even put in until I arrived at the restaurant. I even spoke to a manager while I was there, because I was so pissed. I thought he would have at least offered a free soda, but NOPE!

Wow... what an ordeal. I love the food here, but I probably won't be eating at this restaurant again until the novelty wears off. My time is too valuable.
Went here for breakfast. Had the Seafood Omelette w/ crab, shrimp, asparagus and hollondaise. It wasn't half bad. Waitress was nice and the price was right.

Don't go here for the food, go for the FUN!!!  Weber's used to be "Stewart's Rootbeer" and I grew up going here with my family.  My parents, me and my older sister would pile up in the 1976 Ford Comet, and it was ALWAYS a treat to us!! We loved this place!

What kid wouldn't love the idea of ordering food and eating it in the car drive-in style?  The food was good to me when I was a little, but as an adult, I've come to realize the only good thing they make here are the hotdogs, fries, and rootbeer. If you order anything else, you'll be disappointed by the price,(too expensive for what you get) quality of the food, and the proportions.

This location has an Elvis impersonator whose outfit is badly in need of washing.  LMAO..... kids will love this place.

I've been going to Chubby's every now and then ever since my days of working at Power 99, when the station was located on Domino Lane. I had no idea they had an ongoing rivalry with Dalessandro's across the street. I usually just chose Chubby's because it has a parking lot. Anyway, my fiance and I had Chubby's twice in one week last month. Chicken cheesesteak for me, and a cheesesteak for him.  The first time, my chicken cheesesteak was PERFECT. He thought his was just ok. The second time, we both agreed that both sandwiches were horrible and tasteless. Not sure what went wrong. I guess it depends on who's cooking that night.

NOISY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  If you're expecting a peaceful atmosphere to get work completed, this is NOT the place. It is a very nice looking library, but the staff speaks very loudly and they do not discourage the patrons from speaking loudly either. When did it become ok to use outside voices in a library?  I would recommend bringing your earbuds and turning your music up to full-blast to tune out all the voices.

I like going to this Loft store on Sundays because parking is easy and the store isn't crowded!  Definitely beats making the trek to Springfield or King of Prussia or dealing with traffic and parking downtown. With this location, I can be in and out.

I think I just found my new favorite Indian spot in the city.  I've eaten at several other Indian restaurants in the city, but in my opinion, Laxmi's is the best so far.  My fiance' and I just finished eating  Chicken Makhani, Chicken Padhai, Shrimp Chaat and naan with mango chutney. The food was superb.  To top it off, we had it delivered and they came within 20-25 minutes of us placing the order.

Cant beat an Indian spot that's close by AND delivers!! The prices are a bit steep, but well worth it. Indian food usually IS expensive. I think our dinner came to $47.

Wow... took my car to Jiffy Lube because my car was making an awful squeaking sound.  It sounded like it was coming from the front brakes.  I was told by Jiffy Lube that my car would need brake pads, rotors and calipers. They also said they would "try to save the front calipers if they could."  It sounded like more money than I planned on spending, so I decided to wait and see if any of it was covered by my car's warranty.  The guys here said,"Don't take it to the dealership. All they'll do is gouge you and overcharge you."  Good thing I listened to my intuition.  

I had my car towed to my dealership and was told that there was "nothing wrong with the brakes" and that the squealing I was hearing was caused by a rock that had gotten stuck under the rotor. A ROCK. My dealership didn't charge me anything for removing the rock. Now I ask YOU, who is the real GOUGER here?

The absolute SLOWEST "wifi" ever.  I swear they use dial-up there.  I dread having to go there to print because NOTHING is an easy job with wifi this slow.  They have the self-service machines where you can print things from your Dropbox, Drive, or Cloud, but the internet is sooooooo slow that it takes FOREVER to do something that should take no more than 5 minutes.  I hate Kinko's.

This place reminds me of Panera. It's not better or worse... it just has different soups and sandwiches. Nice to have different choices.

I hade the chicken pesto sandwich and tomato soup. The soup was a little sweet and the consistency was more like tomato SAUCE than SOUP. 

Not a bad spot though, if you can get past the annoying Main Line kids.  lol

I don't know what took us so long to finally try Cafe Lift.  It's definitely going to be one of our "go to" spots from now on. We got there early on Saturday and got a parking spot right in front of the restaurant.  There was no wait, so we breezed on in and got a table immediately.  We loved the menu selection.  My fiance' and I both opted for the Pumpkin Cannoli french toast with walnuts, chocolate chips, and syrup along with some turkey bacon and potatos. Let me just say, it was soooooooo good!!!!!!! Had we known better, we would have shared one plate of the french toast. It was way too much food. If you go, just order ONE, believe me, the waitress will understand!

In my opinion is right up there with some of the better cafes in Philly. For me, it absolutely beats Honey's. The atmosphere was really relaxed. I felt like I could take my time and eat instead of being rushed out because there was a long line of people waiting to get in.

We did NOT enjoy this place.  We had a Groupon voucher for lunch, and THOUGHT we had a good deal. Not so. The food was MEH and as far from authentic Mexican food as you can get. The place is cute, for sure. We ate outside because the weather was perfect.  Our waiter was kind of unenthused about serving us, and you could tell he wanted to be anywhere BUT at work.

We started with some nachos covered in cheese, corn, tomatoes and jalapenos and this was actually the best part of the meal. They were actually delicious! Anyway, I  had the fish tacos (tasteless) and my fiance had the enchiladas (horrible).  I have never had such bad Mexican food.  I was disappointed because I really wanted this place to be good.  It wasn't... and I don't plan to return here.

Had a "situation" at Marshall's yesterday that I found quite upsetting. I found a light fall jacket and brought it into the fitting room to try on. When I got there, I was told I could not try on the jacket in the fitting room and had to use the mirrors in the store to try it on. I found that kind of odd and said to the woman,"Why not? It's clothing. I would like to try it on in private, not in front of everyone." She took the jacket from me and said she would hold it until I was done trying on my other things. A white girl and her mother overheard our conversation, and asked the lady,"Why can't she try it on? You let US try jackets on." Needless to say, I was very upset and reported this to the store manager. The manager assured me she would handle it, but just in case she didn't, I am sharing my story. Just wanted everyone to know that the Marshall's in Springfield, Pennsylvania has a different set of rules for its black customers.
I took my complaint further and reported it to the regional manager.  When they realized I might have a lawsuit, they offered me $500 in store credit .

I like this place. I usually don't like do-it-yourself yogurt places because I'm so un-creative when it comes to figuring out what toppings to use.  They had really good froyo choices, so I couldn't really get it wrong. I had the red velvet, cake batter and cookies and cream, and threw in almonds, rainbow sprinkles, and granola. It was very good.  I think this will be my froyo spot this summer.

Sabrina's has outdone themselves again. Caribbean week was a success! I ordered the Jerk Chicken with Pumpkin Waffles and it was one of the best things I ever ate there. They should definitely keep it on their menu! The chicken was tender, the sauce perfectly spiced, the pineapples were sweet and juicy, and the pumpkin cornmeal waffle complemented the meal! Sooo good!

I have to admit, the food here is pretty good, especially the General Tso's Chicken.  I used to work at a school in that area, and this was one place I ordered from pretty often.  

Also, believe the hype about their wings.  I'm not a wing person, but even I know theirs are very good.
